data.title: The 50 best beaches in and around Chennai (Madras)

placeMetadata.name: Marina Beach

sources.snippet: As one of the longest urban beaches in the world, Marina Beach holds a special place in the hearts of Chennai's residents. Stretching for approximately 13 km along the Bay of Bengal, Marina Beach offers a picturesque backdrop of rolling waves and clear blue skies. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the promenade, indulge in local street food delicacies, or simply bask in the beauty of the sunset over the horizon.
sources.shortName: Chennai Beaches: Exploring the coastal charms of Chennai; A guide to the best beaches

sources.snippet: Kite sellers, cricket enthusiasts, food stalls, families with kids and a bunch of sea gulls…that’s what you’ll find at Chennai’s iconic Marina Beach. With one of the longest stretches of sand in an urban setting, Marina is definitely the most popular beach in Chennai and we strongly recommended a visit to watch the sun set into the Bay of Bengal (or the sunrise, if you are an early riser!). The promenade has a carnival like feel to it with many rides and activities for kids, food stalls selling bhajias and corn-on-the-cob and colorful crowds enjoying a walk amongst the many memorial statues and installations here.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can’t Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, stretches along the Bay of Bengal in Chennai, India. Located in the heart of the city, this iconic beach offers a pleasant escape with its sandy shores, bustling promenade, and opportunities for kite flying and enjoying local street food. Location: Chennai cityActivities: Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks, take in the view of the Bay of Bengal, fly kites, engage in beach sports, and savor delicious street food from the numerous stalls along the promenade.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: The Marina beach is one of the finest and the second longest in the world and ranks first in Asia. The Marina beach which adjoins the Bay of Bengal is located on the eastern side of the city and it stretches to about 12-km long. The beach is characterized by golden sand, good surf and a shimmering clean blue sea which becomes a ground for various entertainments especially in the evenings.
sources.shortName: CHENNAI BEACHES - MADRAS BEACHES

sources.snippet: Marina Beach stretches over 13 kilometers along Bay of Bengal making it among the longest town beaches in the world. Situated in the heart of Chennai; Marina Beach is best known as a place where you can relax as a local or visitor to this city. Sightseers have opportunities to get involved in such activities as horse riding and camel riding, picnicking on the beach among others.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Exotic Beaches Near Chennai For Your Next Getaway

sources.snippet: As yet another Valentine�s Day passed by (without any proposal either way), I longingly remembered the Marina Beach, a hotspot for lovers of Chennai. Madras (Chennai) and Marina go hand-in-hand together; you can�t separate one from the other. As you hear Madras, you can�t help visualizing the long sandy Marina with thrashing waves and throbbing with visitors.
sources.shortName: The Marina beach of Chennai By S Balakrishnan

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, near Triplicane, is India’s longest beach and the world’s second-longest beach. This predominantly sandy area of nearly 12 kilometres extends from Beasant Nagar in the south to Fort St. George in the north. It is a must-visit place for history lovers as they will get to see the magnificent statues of prominent dignitaries from Indian history.
sources.shortName: A comprehensive guide to Chennai's Beaches: Tourist Attractions for all Travellers

sources.snippet: The Marina Beach Chennai is similar in beauty and size to the Copacabana Beach in Brazil and the beaches in Bali and the Bahamas. The name was given by Monstuart Elphinstone Grant-Duff, the Governor of Madras from 1881-1886. Grant-Duff was instrumental in conceiving and converting what was a strip of mud to the present day beach with a beautiful promenade.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach in Chennai

sources.snippet: As far as beaches go, Marina beach tops the list, thanks to where it’s located. Marina beach itself is one of the iconic beaches in the state and is the longest urban beach in India. With more than 100 stalls for food and snacks, a lighthouse to watch the sunset, and several monuments all in one stretch, Marina Beach is where Chennai’s heart belongs.
sources.shortName: Madras Day: Best Places To See In Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach has a rich and fascinating history that dates back to the 19th century. It was developed by the British governor of Madras (now Chennai), Sir Mountstuart Elphinstone Grant Duff, who wanted to create a promenade along the coast for the residents of the city. He named it after the Italian word “marina”, which means “shore” or “coast”.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai’s Iconic Beach

sources.snippet: Marina Beach is among the most popular beaches in Chennai and firmly holds down its place among the must-visit beaches. It is the longest beach in India and ranks second among the longest beaches in the world. Crowds consisting of solo travellers, families frequent this beach to enjoy some quality time, while enjoying the cool sea breeze.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Chennai | Beaches near Chennai

sources.snippet: Overlooking the sea, the Ashtalakshmi Temple majestically stands on the shores of Elliot’s Beach. Consecrated in 1976, the temple is dedicated to the 8 forms of Goddess Lakshmi, believed to be the bestower of wealth and prosperity in Hinduism. The temple has a multi-tier structure, measuring a length of 65 feet and a breadth of 45 feet.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

sources.snippet: Marina beach is full of activity in the early morning hours and in the evenings. Walking along the beaches during sunrise and sunset is a pleasant experience for all. In the evening this beach becomes a fair ground with numerous stalls selling artifacts, handcrafted showpieces, ethnic jewelry, and food items.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai District

sources.snippet: Marina Beach is the most famous beach in Tamil Nadu and is the second largest beach in terms of the coastline it covers which is 13kms. One can take horse ride down the beach and there are a number of sights to witness near the beach. The best time to visit is during the months of November to February.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Chennai, Marina Beach, Elliots Beach, Covelong Beach

sources.snippet: Located amidst the city of Chennai the Marina beach is both historically and geographically significant for India. Situated along the Bay of Bengal its total length spans to over a distance of 13 kilometres. This kind of justifies the fact that it is called as the world’s second longest urban beach.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches In and Around Chennai

sources.snippet: You simply cannot have a conversation about beaches in Chennai without mentioning Marina Beach. It is the longest urban beach in India and quite possibly the first name that comes to mind when mentioning Chennai. It spans over 12 km and is the pride of Chennai.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach of Chennai is the second longest beach in the world. It has a 12km long coastline that is enclosed with palm trees along the promenade. It is a great tourist spot where you can spot locals taking long walks and enjoying the calm sea-breeze.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: This beach has etched a mark on the world map as the second longest beach all over the world and the longest one in India. It stretches to a total of 13 kms. The Marina beach is in continuation with the Bay of Bengal on the Eastern coast of India.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, the world’s second-largest beach, serves as a prominent landmark of Chennai. It’s a place where locals and visitors alike have created cherished memories. A stroll along this coastal paradise is all it takes to free your mind.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach isn’t simply a beach; it’s a famous milestone and the second-longest urban beach in the world. Extending for around 13 kilometers along the Cove of Bengal, it offers stunning perspectives and a dynamic climate.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

placeMetadata.description: Bustling urban beach featuring a long shoreline for basking & a variety of food stalls & shops.

This bustling shoreline is a must-visit destination in Chennai, attracting tourists and locals alike with its lively atmosphere. As you stroll along the sandy expanse, you'll encounter kite sellers and cricket enthusiasts mingling with families enjoying quality time together.

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful place , Location, View Point, It is so Amazing we had enjoyed a lot. With being longest coastal areas. We have walked a very long distance in the coastal lines to enjoy the view from different parts.

Marina Beach is truly the soul of Chennai! It’s one of the longest urban beaches in the world, and the moment you step onto its golden sands, you're welcomed by the soothing sound of waves and a refreshing sea breeze.

This place is an absolute masterpiece by nature. While in the morning with the cold air reaching and the sound of Ocean is just go mind relaxing. I give it a 4 star because of garbage and litter. Otherwise, the atmosphere of the place is extremely good. Best place to picnic or just explore and swim in water. The ocean was kinda salty too.

Weekend Trip Review: This location offers beautiful scenery and is a pleasant place to visit on weekends. However, significant improvements are needed in maintenance and hygiene. Despite these shortcomings, the overall beauty of the area makes it worthwhile.

Marina Beach is Chennai’s most vibrant spot always crowded, always alive. If you’re alone but want to be surrounded by people, this is the place. Expect food carts, toy stalls, rides for kids, and even horse rides along the sand. Be ready to walk about 600 meters on the beach before you reach the waves the city’s noise fades only when you get close to the shore. Parking can be tough, so plan ahead. Come here for the energy, the breeze, and the joy of being part of Chennai’s crowd.

Really was really amazed to see such a big beach in Chennai. It was a famous Marina beach it is a clean beach and also very big as well.The beach length is very big,you can play any sport here.3 to 4 big stadiums can be easily fited here

Good place but overly crowded especially during evenings and on weekends. There are life guards who keep patrolling the whole time. There are various shops for sovenirs and personal items as well. I felt a strong smell of fish along with the litter and garbage in the beach. Overally fine.
The beach is very dirty because of food  vendors selling stuff on the beach side but not cleaned. But I had experienced a stunning sunrise.

placeMetadata.name: Covelong Private Beach

sources.snippet: Situated approximately 40 km south of Chennai, Covelong Beach offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. This pristine stretch of coastline features soft sands, crystal-clear waters, and a tranquil ambiance, making it a favourite destination for beach enthusiasts and water sports aficionados alike. Visitors can indulge in activities such as surfing, swimming, or simply soaking up the sun while admiring the scenic beauty of the surroundings.
sources.shortName: Chennai Beaches: Exploring the coastal charms of Chennai; A guide to the best beaches

sources.snippet: Covelong Beach situated around 40 km southwards across to Chennai city is recognized for its tranquil mood plus water sports activities done thereon. This place provides an opportunity for visitors to engage themselves in surfing, windsurfing, and catamaran rides since it has villages packed around it all through a fishing arena too but with a more modern day lifestyle than depicted above.. Covelong Beach is also home to a historic Dutch fort, now converted into a luxury beach resort, adding to its charm.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Exotic Beaches Near Chennai For Your Next Getaway

sources.snippet: Covelong Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Chennai and is located on Tamil Nadu’s East Coast Road, a scenic roadway that runs along the coast of the Bay of Bengal. Although it is a short drive from the city, travellers continue to come to this Coromandel Coast beach for its swimmable seas, long stretch of pristine sand where you can take a walk, and the numerous food establishments that dot the area. Surfing, on the other hand, is the main attraction.
sources.shortName: A comprehensive guide to Chennai's Beaches: Tourist Attractions for all Travellers

sources.snippet: Covelong Beach, also known as Kovalam Beach, is a picturesque coastal stretch near Chennai. Located a short distance from Chennai city center, this serene beach offers water sports and a tranquil atmosphere for a relaxing getaway. Location:  Kovalam village Distance from Chennai: 40 kms from Chennai.Activities: At Covelong Beach, visitors can enjoy water sports, including windsurfing and kayaking.

sources.snippet: Southern India provides tourists with some of the best beaches, where they can spend a day or two frolicking, amidst the sun and sand. One such beach is Tamilnadu’s Covelong Beach, which provides the ideal atmosphere for coastal relaxation. Also recognised as the Kovalam beach it’s an outlet of the Bay of Bengal which can be found on the Coromandel Coast.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches In and Around Chennai

sources.snippet: Covelong Beach, or Kovalam as it's locally known, is a slice of paradise for Beach lovers. Covelong Beach, with its soothing rhythm of waves, sun-kissed sands, and endless expanse of blue, is your perfect relaxation escape from the fast-paced city life. But there's more to Covelong than just its natural beauty.

sources.snippet: For long weekends and holidays, people flock to this area, and there are a number of posh resorts. The resorts offer a lot of fun and options to play a variety of games like snorkelling, surfing and boating. Lot of fishing activities, take place in this area.

placeMetadata.name: Edward Elliot's Beach

sources.snippet: Elliot's Beach which is also known as Besant Nagar Beach lies approximately 13 kilometers away from central Chennai City itself. Elliot's beach is very popular among families and kids because it has clean sand with gentle waves that break far from shorelines to make swimming safe for children just like any other family-friendly tourist destination all over located within India.. A number of shops; cafes and eateries line up this area making it an active place throughout the year attracting Many visitors come here to swim when they visit Madras during their holidays on account of its trendy eateries outlets serving various types foodstuffs available there beside many shop stalls that have been set up here now.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Exotic Beaches Near Chennai For Your Next Getaway

sources.snippet: Elliot's Beach, also known as Besant Nagar Beach, is a popular coastal destination in Chennai, offering a tranquil escape with its sandy shores and gentle waves. Located in the Besant Nagar neighborhood, it's easily accessible from Chennai and provides opportunities for relaxing by the sea, taking leisurely strolls, and enjoying local seafood. Location: Besant Nagar, Chennai.Distance from Chennai: 13 kms from chennai city centreActivities: At Elliot's Beach, you can relax by the sea, take a leisurely walk along the scenic promenade, and savor the local seafood delicacies at the nearby restaurants.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: One of the cleanest beaches in Chennai is Elliot’s Beach – situated in Besant Nagar, one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city. Enveloped in a friendly vibe, it is a must-visit beach, especially in the evenings when youngsters and families throng the beach. The clean promenade is dotted with trendy restaurants and cafes that see mostly youngsters out for the evening.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can’t Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Elliot’s beach is towards the eastern coast of Tamil Nadu and is considered as one of the cleanest beaches of Chennai. The Ashtalakshmi built on the sand in this beach is a major attraction. It is also very popular as a nightlife beach as scores of youngsters gather in the evenings and night time to hang out with friends and take pleasure in each other’s company.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Named after Edward Elliot, a former high-ranking bureaucrat in the erstwhile Madras Presidency, Elliot's beach is a strong contender amongst the best beach in Chennai. It is located in Besant Nagar and is also referred to as Besant Nagar Beach. Visitors are not barred from swimming, but are warned to do so at their own risk.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Chennai

sources.snippet: Elliot’s Beach is one very beautiful beach in Chennai, and what’s more, it is less dense and crowded than Marina. The sand here is brown, and very clean, while the Schmidt Memorial is a good sightseeing spot. It was built for Karl Schmidt, a Dutch sailor, and attracts visitors with its stories and beauty.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: This beach is one of the cleanest beaches in the city, situated near Beasant Nagar and also called as Adyar Beach. The beach is famous for its night life, and there are a number of eateries near the beach. The Ashtalakshmi Temple is also located on the sand of the Elliot’s beach.

placeMetadata.name: Fort St George

sources.snippet: Considered to be the first ever establishment of British in India, the St. George Fort was built as early as 1644 along the coast of Bay of Bengal. It is the most visited place by tourists as this fort showcases the Church of St. Mary - the oldest Anglican Church in the country and the Wellesley House Museum, within its walls. Travelers can take a look at the oldest structures built by British and experience the architectural splendour of these buildings.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: When the British East India Company built a fort (Fort St. George) and factory (trading post) in 1639�40 in Chennai, the sea was quite close to the fort; in fact, waves were washing the ramparts of the fort. When a harbor was built, it caused sand accretion to the south of these two structures; the sea withdrew to a distance of 2.5km from the fort, leaving a vast stretch of sand.
sources.shortName: The Marina beach of Chennai By S Balakrishnan

sources.snippet: When in Chennai, check out Fort St. George, one of the best places to see in Chennai. This building was the main place for administration during the British rule, and now you can see preserved silverware, paintings, art, arms, porcelain, and documents. Additionally, the flagstaff of Fort St. George is the tallest structure in India.
sources.shortName: Madras Day: Best Places To See In Chennai

sources.snippet: This predominantly sandy of nearly 12 kilometers extends from Beasant Nagar in the south to Fort St. George in the north. Chennai Marina beach was renovated by Governor Mountstuart Elphinstone Grant Duff in 1880s. All tourists traveling to Chennai never miss visiting this grand Chennai beach.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai District

sources.snippet: A 17th-century fort that was built by the British East India Company as their first stronghold in India. It is now a museum that displays artifacts and relics related to the colonial era, such as weapons, uniforms, maps, and paintings.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai’s Iconic Beach

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Fort St. George, constructed in 1640, holds a significant place in Chennai's history as the first British fort in India and the birthplace of the East India Company. This impressive structure marked the establishment of what was known as White Town, contrasting with the nearby Black City. The fort served as a strategic port for England, facilitating trade with regions like Malacca. Inaugurated on St. George’s Day—England's patron saint—the area around Fort St.

placeMetadata.name: Cholamandal Artists Village

sources.snippet: There’s a tropical bohemian groove floating around Injambakkam village, site of the Cholamandal Artists’ Village, 10km south of Chennai's Adyar River…
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai (Madras), India | Attractions

sources.snippet: Chennai’s own little crash course on local indigenous art form — the Cholamandal Artist Village is an artists’ hub where the community farmers to showcase and sell their paintings, sculptures and handicrafts. The gallery setup is modern in its amenities but rustic in its feel, compelling you to believe that you are in a chic little art village. Cholamandal is in Injambakkam region of Chennai and quite renowned among groups that are aesthetically inclined.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: Cholamandal Artists' Village is not only India’s largest artists society but also has a plethora of things to check out including art and crafts, music, dance, and theatre. This community is entirely self-sustained since the time it was built in 1966 and houses some of the country’s most precious sculptures and paintings.
sources.shortName: Madras Day: Best Places To See In Chennai

sources.snippet: The Cholamandal Artists’ Village features art galleries that display pieces by established and budding artists. It also includes a museum and an open-air theater for live demonstrations and performances.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

placeMetadata.description: Oldest artists' commune in India, with art galleries, museums & an open-air theater for dance.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Cholamandal Artists Village, located in Injambakkam village just 10km south of Chennai's Adyar River, is the oldest artists' commune in India. Established in 1966 by the pioneers of modern art in South India, this 4-hectare cooperative features art galleries, museums, and an open-air theater for dance.
placeMetadata.address: Injambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

placeMetadata.name: Palavakkam beach

sources.snippet: Palavakkam Beach is a serene haven that offers a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural richness. Known for its pristine golden sands and tranquil blue waters, this beach stands as a testament to Chennai’s well-preserved coastal charm. The rhythm of local fishing life adds a vibrant touch to the peaceful surroundings, while the presence of an ancient temple infuses the area with historical significance.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Remember those scenes from old movies where people went to beaches that weren’t too crowded, where you could sit on a bench and just enjoy the views of the sea and the cool breeze while kids played in the sand?. You can still have that. At Palavakkam, one of the finest beaches in Chennai, where ‘reel’ becomes ‘real’ and you really do get to do all those things.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can’t Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Located at the southern tip of Chennai in Palavakkam, Palavakkam Beach is a wonderful beach boasting of mesmerising sunrise and sunset views. The highlight of the beach is an age-old temple situated on the beach. The beach has the vast expanse of shores, with stunning views of the horizon merging in the sea.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: Palavakkam Ocean side offers a blend of serenity and experience. The beach is known for its lively climate and is a famous spot for beach volleyball.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Palavakkam Beach is a tranquil escape that beautifully marries natural splendor with cultural depth. Nestled at the southern tip of Chennai, this picturesque beach features soft golden sands and inviting blue waters, making it an ideal spot for relaxation. The vibrant local fishing community adds life to the serene atmosphere, while an ancient temple nearby enriches the area’s historical allure.
placeMetadata.address: Palavakkam Beach Rd, Kottivakkam Kuppam, Palavakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041, India

reviews.reviewText: A beautiful and clean beach in Chennai. The view at night was absolutely amazing and peaceful. It wasn't crowded even during the weekends. If you're planning to visit at night make sure to stay near the shops as it is brighter in that area at night which will be a safer option.

It’s a clean beach and especially if your Parents love to visit beach … it will be very easy for them to walk to the seashore from parking its a very short distance from the road.

You can enjoy some quality family time there without any hassle. The colour of the water is so pleasant to watch😊😎
A calm environment and peace ambience.. No interruptions like Sellers and Stores in the beach part..
"Golden sands, endless waves, and peace in every breeze – Palavakkam Beach feels like home."🌊✨😍💙
Beautiful beach..not much crowd and very clean...❤️🎉
You'll get a peaceful view of the sun if you go for the sunrise.
The beach is neat and clean compared to others. Have a good time there.
Good beach. Less crowded but lot of traffic before entering the beach. Slightly smelly due to fisheries

placeMetadata.name: Kasimedu Beach

sources.snippet: When you want to spend a weekend like the locals you go to Kasimedu, one of the most popular beaches in Chennai. Loved for its beautiful pier, colorful boats and the stunning views of the sea it affords, Kasimedu Beach is where Chennai goes to unwind on a Sunday evening. You will see families with kids strolling along the beach, youngsters playing volleyball or cricket and even people fishing on the shore with home-made fishing lines.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can’t Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach is more than just a scenic retreat; it’s a vibrant hub of local culture and commerce. Known for its bustling fish market and serene seaside views, this beach offers a unique blend of natural beauty and bustling activity. As one of Chennai’s primary fishing centers, Kasimedu Beach provides a fascinating glimpse into the daily life of the local fishing community.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach is comparatively lesser-known among the beaches in Chennai. It is not just a recreation spot but also an important fishing harbour. With a vast expanse of the blue sea and brown sandy shores, you can also find several fishermen at work with their huge fishing nets and boats.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach, with its vibrant fishing harbor, offers a brief look into the customary vocations of Chennai’s coastal communities. Witness the clamoring activities of fishermen and savor the authenticity of this lively coastal area.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

placeMetadata.description: This sandy stretch at a fishing port features walks along a pier & picturesque views of boats.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kasimedu Beach is a lesser-known spot in Chennai, located about 10 km from the city center. It's not just a recreational beach but also an important fishing harbor. The sandy stretch offers picturesque views of boats and a pleasant sea breeze for leisurely walks along the pier. While it's not suitable for swimming due to its function as a man-made bridge for accessing fishing boats, it provides a unique experience different from the more popular Marina Beach.
placeMetadata.address: Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600013, India

reviews.reviewText:
When I feel sad or happy, I need to go and spend the time here mostly, but most of the time I spend time with family members only, I call here. All are interested, they get ready very quickly and they don't waste time at home. We are very special to earth because we have a beach nearby.. enjoy life.. And we have more beach places wherever we will go. It's amazing only, my mom, whenever she goes to the beach she will enjoy it much more.. I spent the first time with my wife and daughter with nature here only, they also enjoyed it.. During college time also I came here more times with my friends, i can't able to write my experience because words can't explain me and my friends enjoyment, happiness and more memorable moments, people i saw here all are very excited and enjoying the nature of beauty, people are came here very long drive and they're all enjoyed and happiness the Beach. I came here when I was in 10th standard with my friends, then I had a lot of fun with them and learned a lot of information. I like to share some happiness here. That's all.. enjoy life more..

காற்றுக்கு எல்லை இல்லையே…

Good beach and great sea breeze through out the  walking stretch along with the beach. You cannot reach to the sea water as this is a man made bridge (road) to access the fishing boats. It is far better breeze and nice experience than Marina Beach. There is no sand in it just a road with stones and concrete blocks to safeguard the road.

If you are in a 2 wheelers, you can go till the end of the fishing harbour. Better to leave the place before sun set.

Mostly, local people will be in the beach.
Government must think and improve the infrastructure and conditions of the entire place like a “Smart City”. It is completely  unattended to improve anything beyond the fishing market which is very sad part.

I was awestruck by the scenic beauty of this beach located in North chennai. Huge fishing boats are parked there. Early morning you will get fresh catch from the sea. Please bargain as they quote high prices.

Kasimedu is a hamlet in the neighbourhood of Royapuram, in Chennai district of Tamil Nadu state in the peninsular India. This hamlet is occupied by fishermen whose families depend on the fishing harbour and the fish market nearby. It stretches for about 2 km, near Ennore fishing harbour along the shore, north of Chennai Port. [1] Large numbers of victims from Kasimedu fishing community were found during the tsunami observed on 26 December 2004. Kasimedu is located at about 5 km from Chennai Beach railway station. Near about 200 tons of fishes are brought to Kasimedu, daily.[2] State Highway 114 (Ennore Express road) passes through Kasimedu.

Awesome………… Place.

Honestly when we decided to visit wasn't excited but the time we reached and looked at the scenes it took our excitement on another level.

Dark blue shining water, it was looking like that someone has spread glitter on top of the water.

In every distance you can see the rocks road which divides water into two parts.

People come here for clicking their photographs with the perfect view on the beach.

There were lots of big fisherman boats. On request they allowed us to get some pic from inside of the boat.

Suggestion: If you love to click yourself with beautiful scenery then this is the place you must visit.

A good place for a small weekend trip with friends and family.... You can feel the fresh air, can smell the sea & can enjoy the beauty of experience.... You can spend a lot of time by watching the fish catching & can taste the local beach foods.

Nice place to hang out with friends especially during mornings & evenings . Cool sea breeze will make you feel comfortable . It is a Fishing Harbour where fishermen have arranged all the boats in a good manner.  Popularly known as N4 beach among the local peoples .
Nice place to spend some times... in evening.. public not allowed after 6pm... kids will enjoy... good place for photography..

Like all ISKCON temples, this temple is also a gorgeous 5-tier sanctum spread across 1.5 acres of land. Some striking features within the temple include a 500-piece Himalayan Quartz Crystal Chandelier that is believed to enhance the spiritual power of the temple and fine teak-wood altars that house the prime deities.

sources.snippet: Chennai’s biggest tourist attraction, the Madras Crocodile Bank is Asia’s first crocodile breeding bank and is home to 2000+ creatures. For the adventurous ones, you can go on snake walks or night feeding sessions and weekend camps when you can see all the action and witness the crocs get cray-cray!
sources.shortName: Madras Day: Best Places To See In Chennai

placeMetadata.description: Longtime reptile zoo & crocodile sanctuary/breeding center with feedings & a night safari.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Madras Crocodile Bank Trust and Centre for Herpetology is a remarkable destination in Chennai that combines wildlife conservation with education. Established in 1976 by the dedicated conservationists Zai and Romulus Whitaker, this facility serves as both a crocodile sanctuary and a breeding center, housing over 2,400 reptiles.
placeMetadata.address: no 4, Post bag, Post Bag No 4, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText: It's the best crocodile park I have ever been too so far it's the most cleanest place ever. The environment everything. Park is so beautiful it's one the best places to visit in india. If u happen to make travel plans to tamil nadu Chennai one the best crocodile park. The crocodile are well taken care it's beautiful to visit with family. Tamil nadu government has been taking good care of the place. I visited from Mumbai with my family and it was best memory. People should visit such places for tourism and to know more about animals like crocodile.  Star rating would also fall less for I'm beyond speechless with my visit. Wish to visit them soon..

Good Place to spend time with your kids and family. My kid really enjoyed his day a lot. He was very happy when he saw the crocodile 😀😁.

You can visit here any time. The Area is completely shaded by trees. It is Little humidity there but no sunlight came directly.

Paid parking -30
Ticket+100 for adults and 50 for kids.
A small canteen is also available at a decent price.

Had a wonderful time at the Crocodile Park! The place was clean, well-maintained, and perfect for a family outing. It's very kid-friendly with safe pathways and informative signboards. Apart from the crocodiles, we also got to see turtles, tortoises, snakes, and a variety of other reptiles. The enclosures were spacious and thoughtfully designed, allowing for a close and safe view of the animals. It’s both fun and educational—highly recommended for kids and adults alike!

Wow! The crocodile park is super cool! You can see so many big, sleepy crocodiles and alligators just hanging out. Some are hiding in the water, and some are sunbathing. It's like a big home just for them! It's a super fun place to visit and see these awesome creatures up close.

A great place for kids to explore and enjoy watching crocodiles and other reptiles. The park has a clean restroom and a canteen for snacks. It’s educational and fun, but some areas need better cleaning. Overall, a good family outing spot with basic facilities and lots to see.

I was aged 8 years when I went here for the first time. Now after 42 years I visited this place again. It was a like a movie running of my childhood. Everything came back to life.

It has almost all varieties of crocodiles here lingeuth monitor lizard and turtles. All are kept separately in big enclosures mimicking there natural habitat. It was still the same as I saw in my childhood.

They previously also had lots of snakes in earthen pots and they used to do venom extraction possibly for medicinal purpose. But this time they didn't had as during this time if the year they release snakes in the wild for mating.

The entry is Rs.100 / person. It was really a nice experience being there again.

Visited this spot and had a great time spotting crocodiles and turtles in their natural habitat. Even caught a glimpse of a few snakes! It's a perfect place to spend an hour, connecting with nature and wildlife. Recommended for kids 6+

Small yet clean and interesting place. There are several types of reptiles specially crocodiles. It gets very hot during the day time. Good place for kids. Have canteen and souvenir shop. Sadly April and May snake extraction unit is shut , which was shut when we visited. Don't miss the Thor. Also there is no night Safari organised (it's closed permanently).

sources.snippet: One of the largest shopping malls in Chennai, Express Avenue mall is established for the brand conscious elite. This mall is besotted with international brands for the crème de la crème of India. A mesh-mash of business and leisure, this mall has been awarded the most admired mall of 2011 in India.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: A mall that is one of the newest and most modern malls in Chennai that features over 200 shops that sell premium and luxury products, such as clothes, shoes, accessories, books, and gadgets. It also has a multiplex cinema, a food court, a gaming zone, and a hotel.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai’s Iconic Beach

placeMetadata.description: Sizable complex featuring a range of retailers & restaurants, plus cinemas & a boutique hotel.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Express Avenue Mall in Chennai is a vibrant destination that seamlessly blends shopping, dining, and entertainment. This expansive complex boasts an impressive array of retailers ranging from high-end brands to charming local boutiques, ensuring there's something for everyone. After indulging in retail therapy, visitors can savor diverse culinary delights at the food court or catch the latest blockbuster at the cinema. Families will appreciate the dedicated kids' play area and gaming arcade, making it a perfect spot for all ages to enjoy a fun-filled day out.
placeMetadata.address: 17, Pattullos Rd, Express Estate, Thousand Lights, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600014, India

reviews.reviewText: I recently visited this mall and had a great experience. The entire place was extremely clean and well-maintained. The environment was peaceful and welcoming, making it a perfect spot for shopping and spending time with family or friends. Everything from the layout to the staff's behavior reflected good management. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a pleasant shopping experience!

I’ve visited Express Avenue Mall many times with both friends and family, and every visit has been a great experience. The mall is spacious, well-maintained, and has something for everyone. Whether you’re in the mood for shopping, watching a movie, grabbing a good meal, or just spending some quality time, this place never disappoints.

There are plenty of popular international and local brands to shop from, and the variety in the food court is amazing from fast food to fine dining. The movie theater is also excellent, with comfortable seating and good sound quality.

What I also love is how clean and organized everything is. Security is good, and parking is convenient. It’s one of those places where you can easily spend a few hours without even realizing it.

Overall, Express Avenue is definitely one of the best malls in Chennai. I always look forward to going back!

A good shopping mall in the heart of Chennai city. It has all varieties of shopping stores and it is a happening place especially during weekends. Parking is available downstairs. Food court is not good as it doesn't offers much restaurant. The mall is good, however the food courts needs more scope for improvement.

Express Avenue is one of the best malls in Chennai. It’s got a nice mix of big brands, local stores, and a solid food court with plenty of options. The cinema here is also really good. It’s spacious, clean, and a great place to hang out with friends or family. Parking can get a bit crowded on weekends, but overall it’s a go-to spot for shopping and chilling in the city.

Express Avenue Mall is one of Chennai’s most popular and upscale shopping destinations. Located in the heart of the city, it offers a great mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment options that cater to a wide range of visitors.

The mall features a good variety of international and Indian brands, from high-end fashion labels to popular high-street stores. Whether you're looking for clothes, electronics, accessories, or cosmetics, you're likely to find what you need here. The layout is spacious, with wide corridors and multiple floors connected by escalators and elevators, making it easy to navigate.

Food options are a major highlight—Express Avenue has a large food court with plenty of choices, from fast food to regional cuisine, as well as several standalone cafes and restaurants. The cinema experience at Escape (by SPI Cinemas) is also top-notch, with comfortable seating and high-quality sound and visuals.

Cleanliness and security are well maintained, and there’s ample parking, although it can get crowded during weekends and holidays.

Pros:

Wide range of stores and brands

Excellent dining options

Modern, clean, and well-maintained environment

Central location

Cons:

Can be very crowded at peak times

Premium pricing at some outlets

Overall, Express Avenue Mall offers a complete shopping and leisure experience and stands out as a must-visit for anyone in Chennai.

If you are looking for a shopping center with local and international branded stores this is the place to go. The express avenue has a lot of branded stores.

I would say the express avenue is the one stop shopping. Apart from many branded stores, there are also many restaurants and cafes as well.
It is also a well maintained shopping center.

Visited  Express Avenue Mall with my college friends right after exams, and it was the perfect break we needed 🎓💆‍♂️🏬. The moment we stepped in, the cool ambiance, wide open space, and calm vibe felt like a treat after all the stress ❄️☀️. We laughed our way through stores like H\&M and Zara, grabbed some tasty food at the big food court 🍕🍔, and ended the day with a relaxing movie at Escape Cinemas 🎬🍿. It wasn’t just a mall visit — it became a memory of freedom, friendship, and pure joy 💖🛍️. Truly a beautiful place to unwind in the heart of Chennai!

All brands are here.
It's convenient in that way chose, compare and buy. End of the story.

Parking facility is good
Parking fees payment via fastag is not available. Entry and exit times are done via number plate scanning.

Weekdays are sure the best time to walk around and shop at leasure, weekends are buzzy and sure there are some offers during weekends.

Wash rooms are losing the charm, needs uplift and maintenance

sources.snippet: Stretching across 10 acres of land, the museum features 18 houses that display the traditional architecture of the different states of South India namely, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, and Andhra Pradesh. Most of these houses, some over 100 years old, were purchased, demolished, carefully transported, and then reconstructed in their original style at Dakshinachitra.

sources.snippet: A museum complex that houses various galleries and exhibits related to art, archaeology, history, zoology, botany, and geology. It is one of the oldest and largest museums in India, and contains rare collections of paintings, sculptures, coins, manuscripts, and fossils.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai’s Iconic Beach

placeMetadata.description: State collections including Indian art & sculpture, bronzes, anthropology & a children's section.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled within the sprawling 16-acre Pantheon Complex, the Government Museum Chennai is a treasure trove of art and history that dates back to its establishment in 1851. This museum features an eclectic mix of collections, including Indian art and sculpture, bronzes from the illustrious Chola Dynasty, and fascinating anthropological artifacts. Visitors can explore various buildings like the Museum Theatre with its stunning Italianate architecture and the Indo-Saracenic National Gallery of Art facade.
placeMetadata.address: Pantheon Rd, Egmore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600008, India

reviews.reviewText:
Well maintained and systematic presentation of displays. All sections are artistically decorated to give the best look. History, Anthropology and children building components of museum are worth visiting.
A library in the centre of museum is another well maintained spot.
Overall excellent. Of course,we could see a part of presentations in 3 hours. Full viewing needs almost full day.
Only thing, which I found at the ticket counter missing was online mode of payment. In this age of technology, museum management must review mode of online payment at reservation counter in place of cash payment for purchase of tickets

Nice and expansive museum with multiple buildings and galleries.
The buildings themselves are beautiful.
Good collection of art and historical artifacts especially of the Dravidian kingdoms.
The Bronze gallery is brilliant.
But the maintenance is slightly poor in the galleries especially in the natural history part and a lot of galleries were closed when we visited in April 2025.
There is a public library also in the campus.

Overall a good place to visit but hope that they improve the overall maintenance of the museum.

The museum ticket is cash only. They don't accept any other mode of payment.

The place is not too bad. The atmosphere here is very nice. There are trees all around and the weather is cool. The library here is very good. This was my personal experience.  I would say everyone should travel, everyone should gain an experience for themselves. Come back at least once.

The Government Museum in the heart of central Chennai is a fascinating place, home to an impressive yet often overlooked collection of history and culture. Unfortunately, the space suffers from poor maintenance. The aesthetics are far from inviting, and the information provided is neither clear nor well-presented, which takes away from the experience. At present, it feels more like a neglected public space than a celebrated cultural landmark. I sincerely hope the government takes steps to revitalize it, perhaps even by collaborating with private partners, so that this treasure can be preserved and appreciated as it truly deserves.

The museum consists of several locations located nearby, which can be visited with one ticket. Fine art, bronze sculptures, a hall of ancient times. It will take about 4 hours to comfortably leisurely walk around everything and enjoy the exhibits and relax in a lively location between the buildings. I was glad to see paintings by Indian artists (though you can't take pictures in these halls), find a portrait of Gandhi, known from banknotes. I was also interested in watching the recreation of the life of ancient people and, of course, examining the building itself: doors, stained glass windows, roof. I recommend visiting! Closed on Fridays.

Nominal fee.. tons of knowledge! There are 6 museum/art galleries in this for 1 ticket.

This is the erstwhile Victoria Memorial Hall built in 1909. The entire enclosure houses contemporary art gallery, children's museum, cafeteria and resting place, a park, archaeological museum and everything under the sun!!

You'll need a half day to cover everything. Worth a visit!

We went to the museum on Sunday. The entry ticket was ₹50 for adults and ₹25 for children. For foreigners, they charge ₹250. The building was beautiful and there were many things to see. There were separate sections in different buildings — like coins, bronze statues, and paintings. The main building has a whale skeleton and skeletons of other animals and birds. Some insects and snakes are also preserved there.

The Egmore Museum is a true gem in the heart of Chennai. Its vast and diverse collection-from ancient sculptures and bronze statues to archaeological marvels and natural history exhibits- offers a fascinating journey through India's rich heritage. The museum is beautifully maintained, and each gallery tells a compelling story that leaves you enriched and inspired. A must-visit for history lovers, students, and anyone curious about our cultural roots. Truly one of Chennai's proudest landmarks!🙌🏻

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Mylapore, Chennai, the Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a magnificent testament to ancient Dravidian architecture and spiritual heritage. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, revered here as Sundareshwarar alongside Goddess Meenakshi, this temple dates back to the 7th century CE.

reviews.reviewText:
A magnificent temple dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva.. As a non Hindu, I found the guided tour of the temple and surrounding sites by our tour company Enchanting Travels to be well researched and informative and the huge temple grounds a must do when visiting Chennai.
We are here during the annual event of 2025. It was an amazing experience.

"Visited and it was truly a serene experience! The architecture is stunning, and the atmosphere is so peaceful. The priests were welcoming, and the rituals were performed with devotion. I felt a deep sense of spirituality and connection. Highly recommend for those seeking solace and tranquility. A must-visit!"

Visited Kapaleeswarar Temple recently, and it was truly a beautiful experience. The gopuram is stunning with its intricate carvings – you can spend quite some time just admiring the details. Inside, the temple has a very peaceful atmosphere despite being busy most of the time. the chants and lamps made it feel even more spiritual.

The area around the temple is also lively with small shops and traditional food stalls, which adds to the charm. Parking can be a bit tricky, and the crowd is usually heavy, but that’s expected at such a famous temple. If you’re in Chennai, this is definitely a must-visit, both for the architecture and the divine experience.

Visiting Kapaleeshwarar Temple was a truly divine experience for me. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the temple’s stunning architecture and intricate carvings are breathtaking. The premises are well maintained, and the atmosphere is filled with peace and devotion. Who ever that visits this temple will definitely feel calm, blessed, and spiritually uplifted.”

It is one of the oldest and powerful Shiva temples, which is located in the middle of Chennai.
One of the best landmarks of Hinduism in Chennai.
Even though it is in mid of Chennai, inside the temple premises, you feel such a divine and spiritual attainment.
Both Shiva and Ambal Sannithi give pleasant and divine feelings.
You will feel more relaxed after getting dharshan from Shiva and Ambaal.
Mostly in the evening, cultural programmes which reflect our traditional and together chanting of the Shiva Puranam give a higher elevation of our spiritual level.

This temple is a true example of South Indian architecture. Built around the 7th century, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Whenever I visit chennai i make sure to go to this temple the aura the architecture the sculpture and the serenity of this hindu temple attracts me so much. Like Gorakhpur temple of UP here also I saw lots of idols of sadhus . Photography of idols is prohibited. This time i visited the temple early morning around 5 am still I could see good number of devotees there.  If visiting Chennai must go to kapaleshwar temple for darshan.

Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Mylapore — a classic Chennai landmark that feels timeless the moment you pass the towering gopuram. The nadaswaram and tavil during puja, the fragrance of jasmine and camphor, and the bustle around the temple tank create a beautiful, old-Madras vibe. Darshan usually moves smoothly; priests are courteous and the premises are kept clean with clear signboards and organized footwear counters. Visit early morning or around the evening aarti for cooler weather and fewer crowds (festival days—especially Panguni Peruvizha/Arubathimoovar—get packed). Dress modestly; photos are fine in the outer prakarams but avoid the sanctum. Parking is easiest around the tank streets.

Secret tip: after offering at Karpagambal’s shrine, step to the Punnai (temple) tree and look up—you’ll spot carvings and imagery of the peacock tied to the temple’s legend. At sunset, walk the tank’s east side for the best reflection shot of the gopuram.

One of very famous temple in Chennai , it is my first visit and had great darshan here . The management maintains the temple and its surrounding in very clean manner . All sannadhis are visible from long itself which I feel so special. Even in heavy crowd can have a good view of Mulavar from outside itself . Idols of 108 Nayanmargal around Mulavaru gives you the divine vibe . Must visit in weekdays as it is lightly crowded even on Friday odd hours . Definitely in weekends or in special occasions temple will be heavily crowded . Must visit Temple OM NAMAH SHIVAYA 🙏

placeMetadata.name: Akkarai Beach

sources.snippet: The sandy coastline begins from Ennore in the north extending south into Uthandi, leaving one to choose from more than just Marina and Elliot's beach. With nicely constructed walkers' paths, convenient seats, adequate lighting, lush green areas and children's playgrounds proposed for select beaches in Chennai initially, there is more to look forward to when you clock in some time for fitness. Location: South Chennai, 24 Km from city centreDistance from Chennai: 25kms Activities: At Akkarai Beach, you can enjoy activities like picnicking, swimming, and simply relaxing by the sea.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: If you’re looking to go to someplace with your friends or family where you can spend your time doing something new every hour then the VGP Golden beach near Akkarai Beach is the best destination for you. Situated in the city of Chennai along the Bay of Bengal, it is a private beach attached to the VGP Universal Kingdom, an amusement park which will spark up your life. Mr. VG Paneerdas had developed the Golden Beach and the VGP Universal Kingdom with the vision of creating a thrilling and engaging site for families or friends to spend their time at.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches In and Around Chennai

sources.snippet: One of the most scenic routes in the country is the East Coast Road in TN, running right along the Bay of Bengal and a drive through here will bring you to equally beautiful destinations – all those quiet, serene beaches, unspoilt and near-pristine. Of all these beaches, we recommend a trip to Akkarai – the best of beaches in Chennai. It does not have the carnival-like vibe of Marina or Elliot’s, it does not have the cafes and restaurants that other beaches boast of and not nearly half as many people.

reviews.reviewText:
Akkarai Beach, located in Chennai, is a pristine and tranquil beach that offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life. The beach is relatively less crowded compared to other popular beaches in the city, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll, a relaxing day by the sea, or a romantic sunset.

Time to Visit - 6-8am
Suggested Duration - 1-2 hours

What to expect?
At Akkarai Beach, you can expect a serene atmosphere, gentle sea breeze, and captivating views of the ocean. The beach is perfect for a leisurely stroll, relaxing under the shade of palm trees, or engaging in beach games with friends and family. The beach also offers stunning views of the sunrise and sunset, making it an ideal spot for photography enthusiasts and nature lovers.

Tips
1. Wear comfortable footwear suitable for walking on sand.
2. Carry essentials like sunscreen, sunglasses, and a hat to protect yourself from the sun.
3. Be mindful of the local environment and avoid littering or disturbing the natural surroundings.
4. Swimming may not be advisable due to strong currents; always exercise caution and follow local guidelines.

Beach Vibe - 5/5
Cleanliness - 3.5/5
Location - 4/5
Maintenance - 2.5/5
Good beach for OMR/ECR residents. No shops in the morning. Just the beautiful sun & the sea! You can find lot of shops in the evening time. Parking can be tricky during peak hours.

The gentle sea breeze and mesmerizing views provide a sense of tranquility and rejuvenation. Don't miss the chance to experience this coastal paradise. reviews.reviewText: The beach has improved itself over the years. To be said when i first came to chennai the beach was barren and shops filled the beach and there were trash here and there. But now the beach is so beautiful.  The air and the sea feels so good over the evening and night sky.

To my surprise, the beach was much cleaner than it was before.
It was not maintained properly earlier, but the beach is clean compared to earlier days.
Now it definitely a must visit place in Chennai.

I’m planning a Marina Beach visit for my photo assignment. Beaches and animals fascinate me. My last trip was unforgettable tall lighthouse, playful dogs, fishermen readying boats, cool breeze and a vibrant sunrise. The peaceful yet lively scene was a perfect mix of nature, energy and emotion I hope to capture again.

Marina Beach is one of the longest urban beaches in the world. The beach stretches endlessly and offers great views of the Bay of Bengal, especially during sunrise and sunset. The vast open space, sea breeze, and golden sand make it a peaceful spot to unwind—from a distance.

That said, the overall experience was mixed. While the beach is iconic and lively, it’s also not very well maintained in many areas. There’s noticeable litter on the sand, and even though clean-up crews are around, the volume of visitors makes it hard to keep up. Swimming is not advisable, as the currents are strong and there are no lifeguards clearly visible.

From a tourist's perspective, it’s worth visiting early in the morning or late in the evening to avoid the heat and large crowds. Street food stalls line the stretch, selling everything from spicy sundal to corn and ice cream. While tempting, hygiene can be a concern, so be cautious. There are also vendors selling souvenirs, toys, and local crafts.

Parking is available near the beach but can be chaotic, especially on weekends. Public toilets exist but are basic and could be better maintained. Nearby attractions include Vivekananda House, light house, and some old colonial buildings that are worth a quick visit.

Marina Beach is best enjoyed for a short stroll, photo ops, and people-watching—but don’t expect a pristine, relaxing beach experience.

Marina Beach is one of the most iconic spots in Chennai and truly lives up to its reputation. The long stretch of golden sand, the sound of waves crashing, and the cool sea breeze make it a perfect place to unwind, especially during early mornings and evenings. It’s also a great spot for walking or just sitting and watching the sunset. The beach is usually crowded, especially on weekends, but the lively atmosphere adds to its charm. There are plenty of street food stalls offering local snacks like sundal and bhajji, which are a must-try. While the beach could be cleaner in some areas, efforts have been made to maintain it better. Overall, Marina Beach offers a refreshing break from city life and is a must-visit for anyone in Chennai.
It's a long sprawling beach near MGR memorial. It was a weekday and beach was full. So many people, hustle bustle. It's a busy place in evening. Many fun activities were there for kids and adults.
This place is good for all kinds of people, Peaceful, Romantic and enjoy horse riding and all kinds of entertainment. You don't forget there fruits and fishes..

placeMetadata.name: Santhome Cathedral Basilica

sources.snippet: The Santhome Cathderal Basilica Church bears a massive significance in the religion of Christianity since it is built on the site where Saint Thomas - one of Jesus’ twelve Apostles died. It is believed that Saint Thomas built a chapel here after he travelled to India in AD 52. Then the Portuguese built the Basilica in the 16th century which was later rebuilt by the British in 1893.

reviews.reviewText: I visited Santhome Cathedral Basilica for the first time, and it was an amazing experience. The church is absolutely beautiful, both inside and out. It’s truly a holy and serene place to spend some quiet time. A must-visit in Chennai for anyone who appreciates historic churches, spiritual spaces, or simply beautiful places. I'm really glad I got the chance to experience it!

It's a spectacular architectural monument made a few steps beside the sea. There's peace and calm inside the church. It's made with great craftsmanship. The views were marvelous both inside and outside. You can just go alone by yourself, sit in the silence and pray, you'll find your inner peace for sure.
And the staff there are helpful and kind as well. Great place for a visit when you're in Chennai.

The tomb of Apostle is at the basement which also has relics and a small museum related to Apostle and Christianity activities.

Neatly maintained and well connected by public transport.

Santhome Cathedral Basilica is a serene and beautifully maintained church with stunning neo-gothic architecture.
Its peaceful ambiance and spiritual atmosphere make it a perfect place for quiet reflection.
The stained-glass windows and intricate interiors are truly captivating.
Located near the beach, it offers both historical significance and scenic surroundings.
A must-visit landmark in Chennai for history lovers and the faithful alike.

St. Thomas Cathedral Basilica in Santhome, Chennai ⛪ is a must-visit for anyone seeking spiritual peace 🙏 and a glimpse into rich Christian history 📜. Built over the tomb of St. Thomas the Apostle 🕊️—one of the 12 Apostles of Jesus—this Basilica is one of only three churches in the world built over an apostle’s tomb, alongside St. Peter’s Basilica in Rome and Santiago de Compostela in Spain 🌍.

At the ground level, there is a small but meaningful museum 🎨 displaying relics and items related to St. Thomas and the history of Santhome. You can see the lance head 🗡️ that pierced him, a rare bone fragment 🦴, his chair, stone receptacle, ancient coins 🪙, Persian medallions, monograms, multilingual inscriptions, and beautiful canvas paintings 🖼️. Each exhibit is well-described with explanatory plaques for context 📖.

Above the museum, there is a mini theatre 🎥 that screens a short documentary on St. Thomas and the history of the Basilica—informative and spiritually enriching.

One of the main attractions is the image of Our Lady of Mylapore 👑. This beautifully carved, three-foot-high wooden statue represents Our Lady seated in prayer. Believed to have been brought by Fr. Gaspar Coelho in 1543, this is the oldest and most beautiful statue of Our Lady in eastern India 🌹.

The Basilica is known for its daily services and peaceful ambiance 🌸. The church offers Holy Masses in both Tamil and English, making it accessible to all.

📅 Mass Timings:

Weekdays: 🕕 05:45 AM – Adoration & Rosary
🕡 06:15 AM – Holy Mass (English)
🕚 11:00 AM – Holy Mass (Tamil – Tomb Chapel)
🕠 05:30 PM – Benediction
🕕 05:45 PM – Rosary
🕡 06:15 PM – Holy Mass (Tamil)

🕯️ Eucharistic Adoration (Mon–Sat): 07:00 AM to 05:30 PM

Sundays: 🕕 06:00 AM – Holy Mass (Tamil)
🕖 07:15 AM – Holy Mass (English)
🕣 08:30 AM – Holy Mass (Tamil)
🕙 10:00 AM – Holy Mass (English)
🕦 11:30 AM – Holy Mass (English)
🕠 05:30 PM – Holy Mass (English – Tomb Chapel)
🕕 06:00 PM – Holy Mass (Tamil) followed by Benediction

🕊️ Historical Note: Pope St. John Paul II visited this Basilica in 1986—the first ever papal visit to India. His presence added to the sanctity and global recognition of this holy site 🙌.

Whether you are visiting for prayer, history, or peace, this place touches your soul ❤️. Highly recommended for all ages and backgrounds 🌟 n

placeMetadata.description: Chennai, on the Bay of Bengal in eastern India, is the capital of the state of Tamil Nadu. The city is home to Fort St. George, built in 1644 and now a museum showcasing the city’s roots as a British military garrison and East India Company trading outpost, when it was called Madras. Religious sites include Kapaleeshwarar Temple, adorned with carved and painted gods, and St. Mary’s, a 17th-century Anglican church.

Once known as Madras, it boasts significant landmarks like Fort St. George, which dates back to 1644 and now serves as a museum reflecting its colonial past. The city's spiritual essence can be felt at the stunning Kapaleeshwarar Temple with its intricate carvings and at St. Mary’s Church, an Anglican gem from the 17th century.

reviews.reviewText:
One of the Best Places to Unwind in Chennai
This serene and beautifully maintained spot in Chennai offers excellent accessibility, making it convenient to reach from any part of the city. It’s a perfect destination to spend quality time with family or to enjoy a peaceful moment alone. The calm atmosphere truly soothes the mind and helps you relax.

The space features luxurious landscaping with ornamental plants, adding to its charm and aesthetic appeal. The restrooms are clean and well-maintained, ensuring a hygienic experience for all visitors. With nominal entry fees, it’s a value-for-money escape within the city.

It’s also a fantastic location for photoshoots with your near and dear ones, thanks to its scenic setting and elegant backdrops. The atrium provides a great venue for hosting small events or performances, making it not just a place to unwind—but also to create beautiful memories.

Despite the number of visitors, the place felt neglected and did not live up to the hype. The entry fee of ₹75 for adults feels overpriced considering the current condition.

The garden might look beautiful during specific flower festivals, but on regular days it lacks proper upkeep and does not justify its reputation. Needs much better maintenance to truly match the expectations set for a botanical attraction.

The Entry Ticket for an Adult is 75 Rupees .. We were visited in the morning 🌄.. But, I would prefer to visit this place in the Evening 🌆✨. Because the lighting setup is there. ( or ) Visit during the Floral Season. That would be nice 🙂. If you're a Flower 🌺 lover 😻, this place is for you. Go & have fun 😊. Of course, go with your family or folks .. Because, there are a lot of places there for taking good photographs... Don't pluck any flowers 🌺, that's an offensive thing.. Maybe, eventually, you need to pay something.. Lot of Species are there..

Lush green patch in the middle of the city. We had a very pleasant walk. It was peaceful and cool. You can feel the difference when you enter. Most "structures" were not covered with plants yet (I think they had places for pots), maybe we visited between changes. Car park was available for 100 rupees and entrance was for 75 per adult. There were slides and swings for children.

Semmozi Poonga is best place for plant lovers. Earlier Woodlands drive-in restaurant is occupied then government converted into park and open to public in 2010. Good things is some of the old trees are retained and developed the park.
Good time to visit the park evening and if you go during oct, nov and dec park will be more greenery.
You can’t enter to specific area inside the park if cinema shooting happen.

So this was6 only garden I visited during my tour of Chennai as I had very limited time,the garden is just amazing you can relax and the surroundings of the garden is very quiet and silent a lot of trees and you can see a variety of birds in the garden as well.There is a ticket of Rs 75

Semmozhi Poonga, located in the heart of Chennai near the Government Museum and Egmore Railway Station, was envisioned as a modern urban park celebrating Tamil language and heritage. While the concept is commendable, the overall experience falls short of expectations, warranting a modest 2-star rating.

**Ambience & Aesthetics (2.5/5):**
The park is built on reclaimed land that was once a degraded area, and its transformation into a landscaped garden is a step in the right direction. The name "Semmozhi Poonga" (Classical Language Park) reflects a noble intent to promote Tamil culture. There are thematic sections dedicated to Tamil literature and poets, along with sculptures and inscriptions. However, the maintenance is inconsistent—patches of dry grass, wilted plants, and unclean water features detract from the visual appeal. The garden lacks the vibrancy and lushness one would expect from a botanical or heritage park.

**Cleanliness & Maintenance (1.5/5):**
This is where the park struggles the most. Littering is common, restrooms are poorly maintained, and there’s a noticeable lack of regular upkeep. Some areas feel neglected, with broken benches and faded signage. The fountains and water bodies often appear stagnant or non-functional, which is disappointing given the park’s central location.

**Visitor Experience (2/5):**
The park is open to the public and is often frequented by families, students, and elderly visitors looking for a green space in the city. It’s relatively peaceful compared to busier parks, but the lack of engaging activities, play areas for children, or proper seating limits its appeal. Security and lighting are adequate during the day, but it's not recommended to visit after dusk.

**Accessibility & Facilities (2/5):**
Located centrally, it's easily accessible by public transport. There’s a nominal entry fee, and security checks are in place. However, facilities like drinking water, clean restrooms, food stalls, and shaded sitting areas are either inadequate or poorly maintained.

**Conclusion:**
Semmozhi Poonga has the potential to be a cultural and ecological gem for Chennai. Unfortunately, poor maintenance, lack of visitor engagement, and inconsistent upkeep bring down the overall experience. With better management and regular care, it could rise to its intended glory. As of now, it’s a decent spot for a quick stroll, but don’t expect a well-groomed or inspiring green space.

**Rating: ★★☆☆☆ (2 out of 5)**
*Recommended for: Casual walk, cultural curiosity. Not ideal for families or nature lovers seeking a serene environment.*

reviews.reviewText:
If you are in Chennai and wish to immerse yourself in spiritual serenity, this temple should be at the top of your list 🫶🏻

📌Standing along the shoreline of Chennai’s Bay of Bengal, Shri Ashtalakshmi Temple is a beacon of spiritual peace.

Constructed in the shape of Om (first Vedic mantra), the temple is dedicated to the eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi, that include wealth, prosperity, success, knowledge, bravery, courage, food and offspring.

The rhythmic sound of waves crashing against the shore and the gentle sea breeze enhance the temple’s tranquil ambience, making it a perfect go to destination with family and friends.

One of the serene and iconic temples in Chennai, this location is often referenced in Tamil fictions. The divine presence of the Astalakshmis alongside Mahavishnu brings a sense of peace and positivity. There is ample parking space near the seashore, making it a perfect spot for a memorable outing on a budget. Although the temple is currently under renovation, it is still worth a visit.

It's a beautiful temple where all Lakshmi  are in one place. Now it's under construction. So far, not all gods  are available.

If you visit this temple you can pray and enjoy the beach aswell.

Visiting the Ashtalakshmi Temple was a soul-soothing experience. Located right by the sea, each form of Goddess Lakshmi radiates a unique energy. I felt peaceful, protected, and truly blessed

The temple is built in the shape of “Om”, which is considered the most sacred sound in Hinduism.
It has four levels, and each form of Lakshmi is placed on a different tier. You climb step-by-step, symbolically ascending towards spiritual growth.
The main shrine houses Lakshmi ji with Lord Vishnu
