sources.snippet: A couple of other beaches in Chennai that you can visit include Bharatiyar Nagar Beach, VGP Golden Beach (within VGP Universal Kingdom), and Neelangarai Beach. Many beach resorts in ECR also offer private beach facilities.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

placeMetadata.description: Big aquarium with 5 aquatic zones, an underwater tunnel, touch-pool exhibit & live feeding shows.
placeMetadata.address: SH 49, Injambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

reviews.reviewText:
It is an amazing place to visit with family with friends.. has got an amazing ambiance, and there are people to explain new stuff.If you were curious..
It was actually my second time going there and I would love to go there again!
Well maintained aquarium and you can go see the sharks and all different types of fishes. Its cool-!! They've got VR and also a cool store at the end ( which might be a little overpriced tho😂 )

Immerse into an aquatic world filled with fascinating sea creatures:

Great experience. It has 5 kingdoms.

At the beginning, you will feel the entry fees is too high and it’s not worth it.

But as you enter the ocean and deep ocean kingdom, you will be fascinated by the variety of aquatic life.

Star fish moving slowly…..Nemo fish living happily with sea animals.

Sharks….Sting Rays….Wow….It gets exciting.

Plan to spend more time in ocean and deep ocean area.

Photography is bit expensive - Rs.350 per photo. Snacks like popcorn is expensive too.

Since we went there near 4 pm, we were also fortunate to deep the scuba divers in the feeding show. Diver feeds all the big fish in a fascinating 10-15 minutes show.

Book a day in advance to avail discounts.

One or two staff are helpful and they explain everything nicely. Try to stay with them and you will be amazed at the beauty of the deep sea.

An Unforgettable Scuba Diving Experience at VGP Marine Kingdom!

I had my first scuba diving experience here, and it was absolutely unforgettable! The trainers were incredibly patient and professional. Before heading into the main pool, they spent around 30 minutes training me, helping me get comfortable with the equipment—especially breathing in and out through the mouth, which was a bit tricky at first.

Once I was ready, diving into the pool surrounded by sharks and bat rays was nothing short of thrilling. It genuinely felt like being in the real ocean, with the presence of these majestic and slightly intimidating creatures all around. It was definitely worth every rupee I spent!

One of the most fascinating parts was watching the team feed the fishes manually. They carried buckets of fish right up to the sharks and other species, feeding them with such confidence—it was a jaw-dropping sight!

Special thanks to Prabhamani from the call center for her fabulous support, and indhu at the Marine Kingdom for being so helpful throughout. The entire scuba team deserves applause for making this a safe and exciting adventure.

Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique underwater experience!

Review:

VGp Marine Kingdom is a wonderful underwater experience! The fish tanks are clean and well maintained, showcasing a wide variety of vibrant marine life. The highlight is the stunning glass tunnel — it truly feels like walking under the sea. Don’t miss the 15-minute real mermaid show — it’s magical and adds a unique touch to the visit. Great place for families and ocean lovers!

* Totally AC inside
* Ticket price is a bit on the higher side (₹745 Adult , 645 Kids)
But available on discount online.

If you are interested in seeing a variety of ocean fishes then you will enjoy it. Kids will enjoy there is a mermaid show too that will also be enjoyed by kids while we are going i saw an early bird offer on the site that is if you book the tickets prior one day you will 750 worth ticket for 550 so just check before the site before planning to this place. This is my personal opinion

We really enjoyed the visit — the aquarium was well-maintained, and the variety of beautiful fish and marine life was impressive. The kids had a fantastic time exploring. Entire staff is quite friendly and guides the path etc . Special mention YAGU for giving little insight about marine life . However, the mermaid attire and photo shoot options were quite expensive, which was a bit of a downside for families with kids. Overall not too tiring and a fun outing .

I spent nearly half a day at VGP Marine Kingdom, and from the moment I stepped in, it truly felt like I had entered a different world.

The entire space is air-conditioned, which is such a relief especially in Chennai’s heat making it a great spot to visit any time of the year, even during peak summer.

The ambiance is beautifully maintained clean, aesthetic, and thoughtfully designed. Every corner feels polished and inviting, which makes it appealing to people of all ages. You can easily spend an entire day here, slowly exploring the exhibits and discovering fish and marine life you’ve probably never seen before.

It was a peaceful, enriching experience overall.

Highly recommended for families, kids, and anyone looking for a relaxed outing with a touch of wonder!

Absolutely stunning. No words. The tunnel was brilliant. Lots of fun activities, things, stores, but the the food court was not so good. very dirty, stray dogs here and there, many stalls closed, too expensive, etc. But would recommend it.

placeMetadata.name: ECR Speedway

sources.snippet: A couple of other beaches in Chennai that you can visit include Bharatiyar Nagar Beach, VGP Golden Beach (within VGP Universal Kingdom), and Neelangarai Beach. Many beach resorts in ECR also offer private beach facilities.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

placeMetadata.address: Field No.1, Survey No.3/481/A2 Near Uthandi Bus Stand, SH 49, Uthandi, Kanathur, Tamil Nadu 600119, India

reviews.reviewText: I would recommend this place to anyone who loves carting. Coming from bangalore the prices here are cheaper and the carts r in good condition too. The tracks are small and one curve is really bumpy

Best place for Adventure Racing and Adult karting in chennai. Good place to chillout with friends gang. Tariff was quite higher but try atleast once for racing experience. Cafeteria hygiene need to be improved.

Karts are maintained in good condition.
If you are good at driving then go time based option. For beginners it’s good to choose lap based option for better experience.

Double seat kart is also available where one can drive and other can simply sit and enjoy the ride.

We visited on 2nd August 2025 between 3–4 PM. The crowd was less, but we still had to wait for around 45 minutes, as the waiting depends on how long previous players take for their rides.

We tried both twin kart and solo kart:

Twin kart: Extremely hard to turn, which made it quite painful to handle. Speed was decent, but the steering effort was too much.

Solo kart: Much better experience with smooth turns and good speed.

Waiting time: ~45 mins
Prices: Vary between weekdays and weekends.

Overall, it’s a fun place to enjoy if you’re prepared for some waiting.

Pretty cool place overall with a decent size track. A few minor things could really improve the whole experience. 1. They only take local India credit cards. Anyone visit from out of country must have enough cash. This posed a problem for our group. 2. Some vehicles worked better than others but the engine is so close with zero barrier, 2 people in our group got burned just trying to put their seatbelt on. 3. Hygiene of helmets and bathrooms could use more focus.

Visited ECR Speedway last week with a bunch of friends and had a great time overall! The track is fun, the vibe is energetic, and it’s a nice way to break out of routine and enjoy something different.

Only downside was the hygiene of the helmets—they really need a refresh because the smell was quite off-putting. Would definitely suggest they improve that.

Apart from that, it’s a solid spot for some friendly racing and a fun outing with your group. Would go again (maybe with my own helmet next time 😄).

Had an amazing experience at ECR Speedways. The place is extremely well managed — from the smooth booking process to the friendly and professional staff. The track is well maintained, and the karts are in great condition, making the whole experience super fun and safe. Definitely one of the best go-karting spots around! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a thrilling time

ECR Speedway – Disappointing Experience with Staff Bias

Went to ECR Speedway excited to try the adult karts. The staff clearly told us that the age limit is 10+ for adult karts, and we were 11 and 13 years old, so we thought it was all good. But then they suddenly changed the reason and said we can’t ride because our legs might not reach the brakes, which made no sense – we were clearly tall enough and even tried to show them.

To make it worse, they gave a kid’s kart to someone else who came after us and didn’t offer us the same option. No explanation, no proper reason. We were just made to sit in the twin kart, which wasn’t what we came for. Felt like straight-up favouritism and very unfair.

We went there to have fun but ended up feeling disappointed. The karts and track might be good, but the way the staff handled the situation was poor.

Not a great experience – hope they treat all visitors fairly in the future.

placeMetadata.name: Church of Our Lady of Light (Luz Church)

sources.snippet: Styled with blue-and-white baroque elegance, pretty little palm-fringed Luz Church is Chennai's oldest European building, dating to 1516 – which also…
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai (Madras), India | Attractions

placeMetadata.description: Small 16th century Portuguese style Catholic church with a gilded interior & Madonna & child shrine.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Our Lady of Light Shrine, also known as Luz Church, is a small 16th-century Catholic church built in Portuguese style. The interior is adorned with gilded decorations and houses a shrine of Madonna and child. Renovated during British rule, the church still retains its original Portuguese architectural design. According to local folklore, Portuguese sailors were guided to shore by a bright white light during a storm at sea.
placeMetadata.address: 156, Luz Church Rd, CIT Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004, India

reviews.reviewText:
Luz Church is also known as Our Lady of Light Church.
It is one of the oldest churches in Chennai, built by the Portuguese in 1516.
It is a beautiful blend of European and Indian architectural styles.
The church has a serene atmosphere, making it a peaceful place for prayer and reflection.
Despite being over 500 years old, it remains well-maintained and continues to be an important place of worship for the local Christian community.
It's one of the oldest church in chennai. It was built in 1516 and it got damaged twice and got rebuild. We can see the historical damaged stone in the church back side
One of the oldest churches in chennai. It was built in 1516. You can even see a tomb from 1637. It is a small beautiful church. A peaceful place to pray. Parking space available.

"Wow, what a beautiful and peaceful place! The Our Lady of Light Church is a stunning example of architecture and faith. The moment you step inside, you can feel the serenity and tranquility that fills the space. The stunning stained-glass windows, intricate details, and beautiful artwork create a sense of awe and wonder.

The community is warm and welcoming, and the services are always uplifting and inspiring. The church has a rich history and a strong sense of tradition, yet it also feels modern and inclusive.

Whether you're a local or just visiting, Our Lady of Light Church is a must-see destination. It's a place where you can connect with your faith, find peace and solace, and feel a sense of belonging.

A church with tremendous history and a must visit in Chennai.

Very quiet and quaint.

Please read up on its history on readily available sources.

Visited the church during a typical Saturday afternoon, it was peaceful, there was serenity, one could feel the calmness and comfort in the air and atmosphere inside.

A rich and historic place of worship which has been standing tall for over 500 years in the heart of chennai is a must visit place for anyone seeking for some peace. The place has ample parking spaces for both 2 wheelers and 4 wheelers and is easy to navigate and locate from the maps as well.

I happen to visit the place as I attended Christmas Service in 2023 by Kuki Worship Service, Chennai. The church is rich in its architecture and design. It look impressive. The church has Hall and dinner hall too. So I mean the church is well equipped with infrastructure and amenities. The place is also clean which adds my likeness to it.

Very Oldest church in Chennai 1572  good view and maintaining with all facilities function hall available with lots of parking and restroom lift facilities also available.
Very attractive golden color biggest church in Chennai. It's very peaceful and very quite.
It's near by Luz corner so much food court and purchase center also available.
Very good location and  Sunday very crowded area very clean hygienic place. Good  atmosphere and maintenance nice

placeMetadata.name: Blue Lagoon Beach Resort

sources.snippet: Among the other famous beach resorts in ecr, a known one is the Blue Lagoon Beach Resort. Noted for its tranquil settings and picturesque gardens, the place is ideal for family parties, reunion and wedding receptions.You can wake up to the lovely view of the crashing waves as all the rooms are beach facing. Adorned with modern amenities, a cozy stay is certainly assured.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts in Chennai, Book Now & Get Upto 50% Off

placeMetadata.description: Vibrant resort complex offering cottage rentals, a swimming pool, game room, gardens & games.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled along the stunning coastline, Blue Lagoon Beach Resort is a vibrant getaway that promises a blend of relaxation and adventure. This serene resort features charming cottage rentals, an inviting swimming pool complete with an artificial waterfall, and lush gardens perfect for leisurely strolls or family gatherings. Ideal for corporate retreats or family reunions, it offers beach-facing rooms where guests can wake up to the soothing sound of waves.
placeMetadata.address: 5/72, East Coast Rd, Raja Nagar, Neelankarai, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

reviews.reviewText: It was really a memorable and enjoyable day @ blue lagoon beach resort. I'm really admired by the place with safe children play park, beautiful swimming pool and breezy beach. The taste of the meal is really the best one. We enjoyed a lot. It is perfect place for a perfect day out

Very good resort at a great location. Have ample space for family / team activities with good parking. Have conducted and attended multiple events here. Rooms are not that great though. Food is fine, but not excellent or great. Service is good, but cannot except finesse. Swimming pool have to be booked in advance. Price is optimal. Overall good.

We had a family get together here. Our experience with the pool and water fall was awesome. Totally enjoyed it. Food was super delicious. Although there's a lot of crowd, everything was organised very well. Place is clean and hygienic. Service too was prompt and good. Overall a very good experience

Our office team outing was a great experience overall. We enjoyed playing various sports including cricket, volleyball, and badminton, which brought everyone together. The beach view was beautiful and added to the atmosphere of the day. While the food was decent, the event could have benefited from better organization and coordination. Despite the minor organizational issues, it was a memorable day that the team thoroughly enjoyed.

Visited for a day outing and had an overall pleasant experience. The food provided was tasty, though the selection was somewhat limited. The pool area stood out — it was clean and well-maintained, perfect for faimly but the time felt limited. Common areas were also tidy and well-kept, contributing to a comfortable and welcoming environment. While a bit more variety in the food options would have enhanced the experience, it's still a great spot for a quick getaway or group outing.

We had our reunion at Blue Lagoon today. The support provided by the staff members was good. However there are certain areas which needs to be improved.

1) Food is very average. It is an non customisable menu. Buffet was served in a common area and more than 250+ people will have food with you during your slot. Good that they gave us seating in a row. Food is not good except very few items.. Chicken starter was soo hard. They give a very big menu, but reality it was not sumptuous.

2) Our team was allocated a lawn area for our gathering. Only chair facility was there. No water facility available, which is very basic necessity.

This is a beautiful and relaxing place that truly lives up to its name. Located right by the beach, the resort offers a peaceful atmosphere, lush greenery, and well-maintained surroundings that make it perfect for a weekend getaway or special occasion.

I recently visited the resort to attend a friend’s wedding held at their marriage hall. The venue was spacious, clean, and very well-organized. The decorations were beautifully done, and the beachside setting added a unique charm to the whole celebration. The staff were courteous and ensured the event ran smoothly.

The ambiance of the resort is calm and refreshing, with plenty of open space and beach access that makes it ideal for both events and leisure. It's a great place to unwind with family or friends, and also perfect for hosting memorable occasions like weddings or receptions.

We celebrated our daughter's birthday at Blue Lagoon Resort Neelankarai, we totally loved it. They offered us a open party area with lawn and other necessities. With their cleanliness, ambiance, space and services, that evening event was outstanding. Overall my kid had a great time and most significantly a delicious supper at reasonable cost.

placeMetadata.name: The Country Club Jade Beach Resort

sources.snippet: This 5 star beach resorts in Chennai offers only the best recreational and clubbing options for individuals who enjoy the finer things in life. A stunning beach view from almost all sides of the property is the main USP of the resort. It makes for a great corporate outing.The place offers all modern amenities and facilities that range from a clubhouse, a gym, a multi-cuisine restaurant in addition to some of the finest suites available.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts in Chennai, Book Now & Get Upto 50% Off

placeMetadata.description: Bayside hotel with breakfast, a pool & a spa, as well as a restaurant with outdoor huts.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Country Club Jade Beach Resort is a luxurious 5-star beach resort in Chennai, offering top-notch recreational and clubbing options for those who appreciate luxury. The property boasts stunning beach views from almost every angle, making it an ideal spot for corporate outings. With modern amenities like a clubhouse, gym, and multi-cuisine restaurant, the resort provides some of the finest suites available.
placeMetadata.address: Thiruporur 211B, East Coast Rd, Nemmeli, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText:
Our recent stay at The Country Club Jade Beach Resort was an experience of pure comfort and relaxation. The room was spacious and well-appointed, providing a perfect sanctuary after a long day of activities. The resort's attention to guest comfort truly made us feel at home.
​The culinary offerings were exceptional, with the Bay Watch Restaurant providing a delightful multi-cuisine experience. We were also impressed with the range of facilities available, including the gym, swimming pool, and spa, all of which contributed to a holistic and rejuvenating stay.
​The resort's prime location on the Bay of Bengal beach stretch offers breathtaking views and easy access to local attractions. Its proximity to Mahabalipuram and Chennai makes it an ideal choice for both leisure and business travelers. The resort's dedicated banquet facilities also make it a popular venue for events and gatherings.
​We were particularly impressed by the efficiency and warmth of the front desk staff, who were always ready to assist with a smile. The availability of indoor games added to the recreational options. Overall, The Country Club Jade Beach Resort is a perfect getaway that combines excellent facilities with a serene environment, and we would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable stay.

Don't ever buy country club membership, my total money and time wasted. We had booked this resort for 2 days but staying there 1 day was very difficult, bed was dirty, bed sheets were smelling bad, room service was not good, food was worst, 2 stars for room as it was little spacious, other than that 1 star is also too much for everything else. They just want us to pay for everything but not hive service for anything. We should have booked a different resort for same price.

The place has kind of lost its yesteryear's glory. If only they could maintain the place better, they could be on the way to compete with the big wigs.
They served the buffet on the table as the number of people were less. That being said I'd give food a definite 4 stars- 1 star less as nobody is perfect ever.
The swimming pool was functional and we spent a considerable amount of time at the pool. The changing rooms require an overhaul. The private beach was good but they could maintain the surroundings better and control the entry of stray cows there.
The indoor games area can have better lighting and be beautified a bit more for aesthetics.
The children's play area too needs a major overhaul to have the place functional and safe for kids.

Lunch is okay, can't say its good. Swimming pool is not well maintained, the floor is broken, chances to injure your foot. Then after swimming pool shower facilities and bathroom is not hygiene. Indoor game area is very hot. Only one fan is there. Ac Is not working. Overall experience is not satisfied compared with our previous visit.

Rooms are not well maintained.
Food we liked it as it was less spicy and there are no side effects. Only con is we are bored of the food in the menu as we stayed for three days.
Service was good especially one anna in the cafe. He tried his best to understand our needs and served us.

Nice and cozy place. Family oriented place. The food was absolutely fabulous. The staff were very friendly. The pool is medium in size and got very crowded few times throughout the day. Very few indoor games, no A/C in the games area. Small park attached with basic playing amenities for kids. Reception area is quite hot to be in as it is not A/Ced. Good location and nice clean beach attached to the property. Worth a visit.

Nice place hangover with family and friends for a day. Swimming pool is well maintained.  Additional charges for using the pool, charging 100 for 2hrs is fine when compare to our local swimming pools inside the city. My kids were enjoyed in pool, park and beach. Provided free face painting washable was really nice, for kids and adults. Varieties are very less but worth for money since the charge is less compare to neighboring resorts.
All together it is good.

Experience was really good and the facilities was as promised. I had organized team outing for around 50 members and they provided free hall and the main highlight was food. It was really tasty and worth. Rest of the things depends on how we want to make use. They had few tents arranged for club members so if someone is looking to make use of such options it would be good for sure.

placeMetadata.name: Green Coconut Resort

sources.snippet: The Green Coconut Resort is one of the many beach resorts that dot the coastline along Mahabalipuram. The coconut garden that surrounds the stay offers tranquillity and serenity as you escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. This is where the corporates can head to for a beguiling experience.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts in Chennai, Book Now & Get Upto 50% Off

placeMetadata.description: Laid-back resort offering free Wi-Fi & breakfast, plus a casual restaurant, a gym & an outdoor pool.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the tranquil embrace of Chennai's lush greenery, Green Coconut Resort offers a delightful escape for those seeking relaxation and connection with nature. This laid-back haven features complimentary Wi-Fi and breakfast, along with a casual restaurant, gym, and an inviting outdoor pool. Guests can choose from spacious cottages or elegantly designed suites that cater to various preferences. The resort is perfect for eco-conscious travelers looking to unwind while enjoying the beauty of their surroundings.
placeMetadata.address: State Highway 49, Muthukadu, Tamil Nadu 603103, India

reviews.reviewText: We had an amazing team outing at this resort! The place is very spacious, with a beautiful lawn and a great selection of indoor and outdoor games. The food was absolutely top-notch, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian – every dish was delicious. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, ensuring we had a smooth and enjoyable experience. A special thanks to Jasmine ma’am, without whom this event wouldn’t have been possible. Highly recommend this place for a relaxing and fun getaway!

Very bad experience! The staff and even the resort manager were super rude, no respect for customers at all. There’s no proper lift service, and privacy is zero. Even after booking the whole bay, random people were coming in and roaming around — we complained to the management but no one cared.

Maintenance is the worst! For room cleaning, we had to call 4-5 times, only then someone would show up. Same with the lift — every single time it stopped working, we had to keep calling the operator again and again.

And the worst part — during our event, the drainage near the food area was leaking! So unhygienic and disgusting. Honestly, such a horrible experience, totally not worth the money!

Perfect One-Day Family Getaway!
We stayed here for just one day with family and had a wonderful time! The resort is well-maintained, clean, and beautifully landscaped. The staff was polite and helpful from check-in to check-out.

The rooms were spacious, neat, and had all the essentials. The kids enjoyed the pool area, and we loved the peaceful nature vibes. The food was tasty and had good variety for both kids and adults.

It’s a great place for a short escape from the city, and perfect for families looking for a relaxing and fun day. Definitely coming back for a longer stay next time!

I had a truly pleasant stay at Green Coconut Resort. The ambiance was calm, quiet, and refreshing—perfect for a peaceful retreat from the city hustle. The surroundings were lush and well-maintained, offering a serene atmosphere that made the stay even more relaxing.

The staff was courteous and attentive, ensuring comfort throughout. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-equipped. I especially enjoyed the poolside and garden areas—ideal for unwinding and soaking in the natural beauty.

Highly recommended for families, couples, or anyone looking to recharge in a tranquil setting.

Extremely Disappointing Stay – Broken Commitments and Poor Service

We booked the entire property for a 3-day stay for the destination marriage, expecting a smooth and enjoyable experience based on the management’s commitments. Unfortunately, what we received was far from acceptable and caused significant inconvenience and embarrassment.

Despite booking the entire venue, we were shocked to discover that other guests had also been accommodated, causing major discomfort and overcrowding. The basic promise of daily linen and towel changes was completely ignored—not even a single change happened during our stay. they have only one small lift can accommodate two people at a time, event that also not worked properly.

The washrooms were in terrible condition: water flow was extremely slow, taps were broken, and faucets didn’t function properly. Even worse, we were denied access to the large swimming pool that was clearly advertised as available for guests.

One of the most frustrating issues was the complete failure to supply drinking water in the rooms as promised. With 74 rooms booked, not even one refill was done throughout the stay.

The decoration vendor caused damages, but strangely, we were asked to pay for it by unrelated parties like the green coconut supplier—absolutely unprofessional and unfair.

We had also requested 3 wheelchairs for a large group of over 200 guests. Only one was provided, despite repeated reminders. We paid ₹60,000 per day for kitchen usage, yet it was poorly maintained, and the drainage area broke down during the event, leading to overflow and a horrible mess.

Staff behavior was another low point—they were outright rude, used foul language in front of guests, and showed no sense of hospitality. Many rooms were dirty, had non-functioning air conditioning, broken power sockets, badly arranged furniture, and unwashed curtains.

To top it all, they promised 20 safety locks but didn’t hand over a single key. At the end, without delivering any of the promised services, they were aggressive and confrontational about payment.

Overall, this was an extremely disappointing and unprofessional experience. We expected hospitality, but were met with negligence and hostility. Not recommended.

Never stayed anywhere else in India before, so can't offer any comparison there, but this resort is just lovely. We came to attend a wedding being held on site, and I really just have nothing negative to say about the place at all. The room was very clean and nicely appointed, and the entire staff was friendly,  courteous, and attentive - from the groundskeepers, to the attendants at the front desk, to the wait staff at the restaurant, to the owners themselves. They even accommodated our evidently unusual fondness for black coffee. :)

Extremely Disappointing Stay

Our team recently stayed at your hotel in Room 402, and we had a highly disappointing experience. The air conditioning was completely non-functional, yet we were still charged for it. This made our stay extremely uncomfortable and inconvenient.

It is unacceptable to charge guests for services that are not provided. Based on our experience, we strongly do not recommend this hotel to anyone. We hope the management takes immediate steps to improve their facilities and service standards to avoid similar issues for future guests.

It is a mixture of good and good. Great ambiance with spacious rooms but the Rooms were not clean and WIFI was not working. The entire resort was huge and many activities are available for kids and adults.Since we complained about the room we were upgraded to a premium room. The food is good but slightly on the expensive side. The menu is exclusive to GST. It has a great potential to have a 5 star rating but there are let down as well.

placeMetadata.name: Mystery Rooms Chennai - OFFICIAL Escape Rooms

sources.snippet: The beach has an entry ticket of INR 20 and provides various amenities such as ample parking space, clean changing rooms, washrooms, paved roads, thatched umbrellas and sunbath cane recliners, a children’s play area, and small eateries.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Mystery Rooms Chennai - OFFICIAL Escape Rooms is a thrilling and immersive experience perfect for families, couples, and friends. It offers an exciting challenge where teams must work together to solve clues and escape from locked rooms within a time limit. The establishment provides a real-life gaming adventure that engages all the senses. With various game options like Kohinoor diamond and cabin in woods, visitors can enjoy an hour of brain-teasing fun with impressive setups and sound effects.
placeMetadata.address: 24, 2nd Flr, College Rd, above Kora), BBCL Magnum, Nungambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600006, India

reviews.reviewText: Gamemaster Aravind was very friendly and patient with the three 10 year olds we"d gone with. They loved the whole "lockout" experience and according to them, would rate it a million stars :)

Great place to hangout but fares are a bit high for just an hour. And it ends even before you do 1/3rd of the game. They shd either increase the time to 1.5 hrs or decrease the fare a bit. Plus no refreshments provided after paying 800 per hour. Nothing available either. Soft drinks are available which are charged separately . So I guess service and fares could be better

It was a really fun experience. We played cabin in the woods with a few of our friends. Abhimanue sir, our host was the most patient yet enthusiastic person I've met, and out game master, muthu sir was very helpful to us. The puzzles are quite difficult, which I appreciate alot. Perfect for special occasions :)

Very terrible experience with Mystery Rooms Nungambakkam.

We had booked the “Hangover” theme for 5 persons the day before. Got an email saying we’d receive a call to confirm our booking but never got one - so we called ourselves and they confirmed.

However, upon reaching, they said there was a technical difficulty and the game was
unavailable since yesterday night - they didn’t even care to inform us even when we called 30 mins before. They did not have any other theme available either - we drove over 15 km for absolutely nothing. They only gave excuses and tried to make us go away.

Incredibly poor customer service - wouldn’t recommend to anybody who wants to rest assured that they’ve made a booking and will be let in.

This place is awesome. We have tried two of the rooms till now, the lockout and a night in bhangarh. They were both really challenging and made us really use our heads. Especially bhangarh, which was a dark room puzzle. The effects plus the puzzles kept us super invested. Plus the staff here are so friendly and helpful. It was a joy to experience the rooms and we can't wait to try out the other rooms

One of the best mystery rooms in Chennai. Played 2 of their games and absolutely loved it. The staff are very helpful and make the whole experience that much more enjoyable! Definitely going back for more.
AMAAAZING EXPERIENCE. Went for A Night in Bhangarh and Cabin in the Woods... Surya and Praveen Kumar guided us through the two games we played. Was just awesome!! We are coming back again for sure

The mystery room is experience was an awesome experience. We went in a team of two and it was 1 hours of brainstorming and fun throughout. I thank the host Abhimanyu and the host Muthu for arranging such an awesome experience.

placeMetadata.name: CHENNAI CITI CENTRE

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of Chennai, this prominent city centre boasts vibrant attractions. It is a hub for leisure activities, cultural events, and recreational pursuits. With its bustling markets, diverse culinary scene, and historical landmarks, it captivates visitors.
sources.shortName: 11 Famous Beaches in Chennai You Must Visit

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chennai Citi Centre is a premier destination for leisure, entertainment, and shopping in the heart of Chennai. It offers a wide array of shopping, dining, and entertainment experiences. Situated near popular tourist attractions like Marina Beach and Kapaleeswarar Temple, it's a favored spot for tourists seeking leisure activities. The mall's striking architecture captivates visitors upon arrival, while its multiple luxury brands and expansive floors make it an enticing shopping haven.
placeMetadata.address: 10/11, Dr Radha Krishnan Salai, Loganathan Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004, India

reviews.reviewText:
Chennai Citi Center is a popular shopping mall located in the heart of Chennai. Situated in the Mylapore area. This mall has a long history and was once one of the most popular shopping destinations in Chennai. it is known for its vibrant shopping experience and wide range of entertainment options. The mall features a variety of retail outlets, ranging from national and international brands to local stores, offering everything from fashion and electronics to lifestyle products.
However, it now feels quite outdated, with fewer shops and a somewhat dull atmosphere compared to its earlier days. Recently, VGP opened a kids' play area here, which has added some fresh energy and vibrance to the place. While this is a positive step, the mall still needs more new, attractive stores to truly regain its charm. Overall, it's a decent spot for a quick visit, but it could be much better with some thoughtful updates and modern amenities.

Chennai Citi Center is a popular shopping mall located in the heart of Chennai, India. Situated in the Mylapore area, it is known for its vibrant shopping experience and wide range of entertainment options. The mall features a variety of retail outlets, ranging from national and international brands to local stores, offering everything from fashion and electronics to lifestyle products.

Besides shopping, Chennai Citi Center also has a food court with diverse dining options and a multiplex cinema for movie-goers. It is a favorite destination for both locals and tourists, attracting a crowd for its central location and blend of modern amenities with the traditional charm of the city. The mall is a great spot for casual hangouts, shopping, and enjoying a fun day out with family or friends.

The name Citi Center, Mylapore, always reminds me of the movie *Kaka Muttai*—funny how I knew about this mall through the movie despite being in TN! It's actually a great spot with stores like Zuido, Style Union, Westside, Lenskart, and even KFC. The Cyber Bunk area is extraordinary, with amazing vibes and a well-designed space. Definitely planning to watch a movie at the INOX located here next time!

Worst Mall in Chennai

Citi Centre is the worst mall I’ve ever been to. The food court is empty and sad. KFC is the best option, and even that has no proper food left. Cold chicken, half the menu not available, and the staff look tired and lost.

The whole place feels dead. Dirty walls, broken lights, and a weird smell everywhere. Most shops are closed. It feels like an abandoned building, not a mall.

The theatre is a nightmare. Drunk men were shouting, people were talking loudly on their phones, and others came just to eat and chat. No one watched the movie. No staff to control the mess. The screen and sound were bad too.

This place is a total waste of time. Feels more like a slum than a mall. Avoid it completely.

Lot has changed but the view from the terrace is just beautiful as the day the building was first opened. Fewer shops, in a way it's quiet and nice. Arcade and bowling is functional. Not overcrowded, food court has wide range of food and drinks. Calm and crowd free place to hangout with friends and family.

Came to the mall to watch movie in inox. We didn’t knw mall is under construction, be prepared for that. You can enjoy the movie in inox but don’t expect any from the mall until the construction is over. Theater was good and popcorn and tea are nice.

Update July 2025: fully constructed mall was good. There was fashion jewelry fair when we went and theater was okie. Mall is smaller than others in Chennai but it is new.

Today, I had the pleasure of visiting Chennai's iconic Chennai City Centre, one of the oldest malls in the city. As soon as I entered the mall, I was greeted by a vibrant and bustling atmosphere that immediately lifted my spirits. The Inox theater within the mall was a real treat, with its comfortable seating and top-notch sound system providing the perfect setting for an enjoyable movie-watching experience. What impressed me the most was the impeccable architecture of the mall, which seamlessly blended modern design elements with traditional touches, creating a unique and visually stunning space. Additionally, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the parking fee was only 50 rupees, making it convenient and affordable for visitors like me. Overall, my visit to Chennai City Centre was a delightful experience, filled with happy moments and fond memories that I will cherish for a long time.

My rating was

Ambiance:4/5
Parking:4/5
Hygiene:4/5
Maintenance:4/5

After a long time, I visited Chennai City Centre. We initially went to shop at Zudio, but due to the heavy crowd, we skipped shopping there. Instead, the kids enjoyed a small car ride in front of the mall. Unlike my last visit, I noticed that there are very few shops operating in this mall now, with only the theatre still functioning. However, they still charge ₹40 per hour for car parking, which feels quite high considering the reduced number of shops.

ops.insert: Bustling urban beach featuring a long shoreline for basking & a variety of food stalls & shops.
Popular beach offering a sandy shoreline & swimming spots, plus the Karl Schmidt Memorial.
Oldest artists' commune in India, with art galleries, museums & an open-air theater for dance.
This sandy stretch at a fishing port features walks along a pier & picturesque views of boats.

Sizable complex featuring a range of retailers & restaurants, plus cinemas & a boutique hotel.
State collections including Indian art & sculpture, bronzes, anthropology & a children's section.
This large sandy beach is a popular escape for locals & visitors to Chennai.
Easygoing beach known for its relaxed vibe away from crowds & with a nearby ice cream shop.
Cathedral basilica rebuilt in 1896 in neo-Gothic style, at the site of St. Thomas Apostle's tomb.
This colourful, multi-level seaside temple with ornate details honours the Hindu goddess Lakshmi.
Long-standing shopping mall featuring an array of common retailers, along with eateries.

Chennai, on the Bay of Bengal in eastern India, is the capital of the state of Tamil Nadu. The city is home to Fort St. George, built in 1644 and now a museum showcasing the city’s roots as a British military garrison and East India Company trading outpost, when it was called Madras. Religious sites include Kapaleeshwarar Temple, adorned with carved and painted gods, and St. Mary’s, a 17th-century Anglican church.
Serene botanical garden with over 500 species of plants, including exotic varieties.
Multi-campus, public academic institution, founded in 1857 and based in Chennai with 68 departments.
This large Indo-Saracenic-style building was the residence of the Nawab of Arcot from 1768 to 1855.

Thyagaraya Nagar, known locally as T. Nagar, is a bustling shopping district with stores and street vendors selling colourful saris, gold jewelry and produce at budget prices, especially along Ranganathan Street. The area’s side streets are dotted with casual eateries and food stalls offering traditional South Indian meals. Close by, elegant art deco bungalows line G.N. Chetty Road.

Besant Nagar is an upscale, coastal neighborhood with a lively vibe. Landmarks around sandy Elliot’s Beach include the Sri Ashtalakshmi Temple, dedicated to the 8 avatars of Goddess Lakshmi, and the Karl Schmidt Memorial, which commemorates a European sailor. Christians pray to the Virgin Mary at Annai Vailankanni Shrine. Near the beach, relaxed cafes, fast-food joints and South Indian eateries fill up with locals.
Sacred 8th-century temple honouring the god Krishna, with ornately carved towers & columns.
Indoor attraction featuring manmade snow, sledding, a mountain for climbing & upbeat music.
Whimsical amusement park with bumper cars, a roller coaster & other rides, plus live entertainment.
Big aquarium with 5 aquatic zones, an underwater tunnel, touch-pool exhibit & live feeding shows.
Former ice store where Swami Vivekananda stayed in 1897, now a permanent exhibition on his life.
Pondy Bazaar, officially called Soundarapandianar Angadi, is a market and neighborhood located in T. Nagar, Chennai, India. It is one of the principal shopping districts of Chennai. Wikipedia.
A cave with tiger-head carvings is among the ruins of this 8th-century carved-stone Hindu temple.

ops.insert: Thiruvanmiyur is a largely residential neighborhood located in the south of Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. Thiruvanmiyur witnessed a spike in its economy with the construction of Chennai's first dedicated technology office space, the Tidel Information Technology Park in neighboring Taramani. Wikipedia.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Chennai, the vibrant capital of Tamil Nadu, is not just a hub of culture and history; it also boasts some of the most stunning beaches along the Bay of Bengal. From the bustling sands of Marina Beach, where families gather for evening strolls and cricket matches, to the serene shores of Edward Elliot's Beach, each stretch of coastline offers a unique experience. Whether you're looking to soak up the sun, enjoy a peaceful escape, or indulge in local street food, Chennai's beaches cater to every kind of traveler.

As you explore the coastline, you'll discover hidden gems like Akkarai Beach and the picturesque Palavakkam Beach, perfect for those seeking tranquility away from the crowds. The Wanderlog team is passionate about uncovering the best spots to relax and unwind, and we can't wait to share our favorite beaches with you. So grab your sunscreen and get ready to dive into the sun-soaked beauty of Chennai's coastline!

One of the most adored weekend getaways from the town of Chennai, the Yelagiri hill station is a beautiful paradise to crawl for the ardent nature lovers. Blessed with balmy weather, and spectacular vistas, the Yelagiri hill station features a cluster of 14 small villages located amidst the lush green mountain ranges.
sources.shortName: 26 Tourist Places Near Chennai Within 100 kms to 600 Kms

sources.snippet: One of the most popular tourist places near Chennai within 100 kms is the ancient town Mahabalipuram. This historically-rich town is best known for its architecturally-divine temples, rich literature, and monolithic rock shrines. The town is also known as Mamallapuram and it serves as the beachside tourism centre.

placeMetadata.description: Chennai, on the Bay of Bengal in eastern India, is the capital of the state of Tamil Nadu. The city is home to Fort St. George, built in 1644 and now a museum showcasing the city’s roots as a British military garrison and East India Company trading outpost, when it was called Madras. Religious sites include Kapaleeshwarar Temple, adorned with carved and painted gods, and St. Mary’s, a 17th-century Anglican church.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chennai, the vibrant capital of Tamil Nadu, is a city steeped in history and culture along the picturesque Bay of Bengal. Once known as Madras, it boasts significant landmarks like Fort St. George, which dates back to 1644 and now serves as a museum reflecting its colonial past. The city's spiritual essence can be felt at the stunning Kapaleeshwarar Temple with its intricate carvings and at St. Mary’s Church, an Anglican gem from the 17th century.
placeMetadata.address: Tamil Nadu, India

placeMetadata.name: Guindy

sources.shortName: The Best Trekking Spot — Nagalapuram Waterfalls | by Jack Anto

placeMetadata.description: A largely industrial district, Guindy is also home to Guindy National Park, a tropical forest inhabited by blackbucks, jackals and dozens of butterfly species. Pythons and cobras are the main attraction at the Chennai Snake Park on the edge of the forest. Nearby, St. Thomas Mount is a Christian pilgrimage site, where the apostle is believed to have been martyred. The site has a colonial church and panoramic views.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Guindy is a diverse district in Chennai, known for its industrial presence and natural attractions. The Guindy National Park is a prominent feature, boasting a tropical forest that houses various wildlife such as blackbucks, jackals, and numerous butterfly species. Additionally, the Chennai Snake Park located on the forest's edge showcases pythons and cobras. For those interested in religious history, St. Thomas Mount serves as a Christian pilgrimage site with a colonial church and stunning panoramic views.
placeMetadata.address: Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India

placeMetadata.description: Whimsical amusement park with bumper cars, a roller coaster & other rides, plus live entertainment.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: VGP Universal Kingdom is a sprawling amusement park located in Chennai, known for its extensive range of entertainment options suitable for all age groups. Established in 1975, this expansive 45-acre park features over 50 amusement rides, a private beach, petting zoo, and three restaurants. Visitors can enjoy live shows encompassing music, dance, theater, and puppetry. The park offers an exhilarating mix of thrilling rides and water attractions alongside entertaining live performances throughout the year.
placeMetadata.address: SH 49, Injambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

reviews.reviewText: Great place for families, couples and friends. Crowd control was good. Kids will definitely enjoy. But poor safety measures. Especially the ray fish sections. Parents keep your kids with you all the time.,

Dry rides are kinda ok ,there was only less variety of water games
Tickets are of Rs.850
There is a food court inside and the prices are too high. ( curd rice for Rs.85 )
Restrooms needed improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are not active in the afternoon but in evening. Evening vgp rides with lights are so good to see . Overall it was good👍

It is a wonderful and peaceful place. I will try again. It is a great place to go here and get peace of mind. You should try to go here with your family.I was here getting ready the whole day and I didn’t even realize the time.This is not an emotional park, this is a haven, it will fill your heart with happiness. It is a very good place.You should also go with your family. This is a very good place. I will give you five star feedback from my side. This place is very good.

Majority of the rides were not working when I went. And all other rides were not upto the level. I don't know what their maintenance dept is doing. But it had a nice water park. You can enjoy a day with your family and friends.

VGP Marine Kingdom in Chennai offers an incredible experience, especially with its 70-meter underwater tunnel. Walking through this tunnel, surrounded by diverse marine life swimming overhead, was truly mesmerizing. The aquarium is well-maintained and showcases a variety of aquatic species, making it a delightful visit for both adults and children.

My friends and I had a great time at VGP Universal Kingdom! Although some of the main rides were under maintenance due to recent incidents, the experience was still amazing. A few new rides have been opened, and they were absolutely thrilling. The highlight of our visit was the wave pool — the DJ kept the energy high, and we spent most of our time enjoying the waves and the water rides. Overall, a fun and refreshing day!.

Best place to spend your holidays with your family and friends. We had a wonderful experience. Kids were thoroughly enjoyed riding  and water parks.

For playing in water games, you have to wear tshirt,  you can bring your own tshirt or  can buy tshirt from there for Rs.100 each. Better to bring your own tshirt, shower cap.

Small birds park also there. You can feed them.

If you bring snacks and lunch with you can spend your whole day. It's very hot during this summer, so cap is must.

We went on weekend only, not much crowded.

Worth for money.

Weekends are fully packed. There is alot of dry and wet activities in the park. Tickets are priced at 850 INR. There is alot of improvement required, the water gets dirty and there is so much dirt in the water. The water activities, the balloon seater is less compared to the crowd, you may have to wait a very long time. Bathroom also need improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are out of order or not active. Overall it is good to spend the day.

sources.snippet: Route: Kathipara Flyover → Koyambedu Flyover → Madhavaram Roundabout (Take left) → Puzhal (NH 16) → Redhills (NH 16) →TN Toll Gate (NH 16) → Take left on Tirupati Road → Take Left post Periyapalayam Bus Stop → Uthukottai (Tamil Nadu Border) → Into Andra Pradesh → Take Right, the road will divide like a ‘Y’ but you don’t get it to follow the map, which I shared (#1 Image Attached) → Pitchatur Bus stand take the dead end right → Pitchatur Dam you will travel adjacent to Dam walls → Tree in the Center (1st Landmark — #2 Image attached) → Take Right (opposite to right you will find a small temple. And also you will see Arai Falls signboard. — #3 Image Attached) → Nagalpuram Waterfalls Parking Slot.

ops.insert: Chennai, on the Bay of Bengal in eastern India, is the capital of the state of Tamil Nadu. The city is home to Fort St. George, built in 1644 and now a museum showcasing the city’s roots as a British military garrison and East India Company trading outpost, when it was called Madras. Religious sites include Kapaleeshwarar Temple, adorned with carved and painted gods, and St. Mary’s, a 17th-century Anglican church.
Whimsical amusement park with bumper cars, a roller coaster & other rides, plus live entertainment.

A largely industrial district, Guindy is also home to Guindy National Park, a tropical forest inhabited by blackbucks, jackals and dozens of butterfly species. Pythons and cobras are the main attraction at the Chennai Snake Park on the edge of the forest. Nearby, St. Thomas Mount is a Christian pilgrimage site, where the apostle is believed to have been martyred. The site has a colonial church and panoramic views.
Sengundram, known in English as Red Hills, is a suburb in the northwestern part of Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India in Thiruvallur District. Wikipedia.

Pulhal or Pullhal is a Northwestern residential town in Chennai district in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. Pullhal is located on the banks of Pullhal Lake. The town is known for Pullhal Central Prison.
The area is one of the 163 notified areas in the state of Tamil Nadu. Wikipedia.

data.title: The 25 best national parks around Chennai (Madras)

placeMetadata.name: Guindy National Park

sources.snippet: The Guindy National Park may be one of the country’s smallest national parks, but it has the unique distinction of being the only one located completely within the limits of a major urban centre. The National Park is sandwiched between two other sprawling green spaces in Chennai, the IIT Madras campus and the Raj Bhavan, and houses over 130 species of birds, 14 species of mammals and several hundred species of insects, butterflies and spiders. Together with its vast variety of flora, the National Park is one of the most-visited green spaces in the state, attracting some 700,000 visitors annually.
sources.shortName: The Best Places For Wildlife Enthusiasts To Visit In Chennai

sources.snippet: Our city may take pride in the fact that it has Guindy National Park (GNP), one of the oldest reserve forests right in its midst, but if the Government is allowed to have its way, all this will soon be gone. It is learnt that the State Government has written to the Union Ministry of Environment and Forests (MOEF) that the mandatory eco-sensitive buffer zone around the park be removed. This is ostensibly to facilitate the construction of buildings by Government-supported organisations and institutions in the vicinity.
sources.shortName: Madras Musings - We care for Madras that is Chennai

sources.snippet: Guindy National Park is the protected area that has been spread over the area of about 2.82 km2 (1.09 sq mi) of Tamil Nadu, which is situated in Chennai of South India. This is the 8th smallest National park of India and is one among the very few National parks that are situated within the city. This park is surrounded by the Raj Bhavan that is an extension of the grounds formerly known as the Guindy Lodge' that was given to the Governor of Tamilnadu as the as the official residence.
sources.shortName: Details of Guindy National Park, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Sharing walls with the Chennai Snake Park, the Guindy National Park originally encompassed the Raj Bhavan as well, but is a separate space now. The size of it is hard to comprehend, and parts of it are closed to the public, but with passes obtained, you can see blackbuck, spotted deer and jackals in their natural habitat. It’s one of the few national parks entirely inside a city and is a popular spot for school excursions and the like.
sources.shortName: Best Places To Experience Wildlife In Chennai I

sources.snippet: Sprawling over 2.70 KM square of land, Guindy National Park has been ranked the eighth smallest national park of India. Also, it is the only park situated right in the middle of a city. Established in the year 1978, the park got its protective atmosphere to preserve some of the rare and endangered species of wildlife.
sources.shortName: How To Reach, Best Time & Tips

sources.snippet: This is another national park located at the heart of the city. It is home of different species of deer and an exotic range of birds and snakes. The main advantage of visiting this park is that it is within city limits, therefore easily approachable and considered an ideal weekend getaway with family.
sources.shortName: Zoos in Chennai, Wildlife Sanctuaries in Chennai, Chennai Zoo

placeMetadata.name: Chennai Snake Park

sources.snippet: Bordering the sprawling Guindy National Park is the Chennai Snake Park and Children’s Park, which is one of the largest ex-situ conservation sites for reptiles in the city. Carved out the earlier forest regions of the ‘Guindy Lodge’, the Snake Park was conferred with the status of a medium zoo by the Central Zoo Authority in the 90s and became Chennai’s only zoo located within city limits. It’s a popular destination for wildlife enthusiasts and conservationists and contains several reptile species, including the king cobra, python, vipers, and mammals such as deer, jackals and porcupines.
sources.shortName: The Best Places For Wildlife Enthusiasts To Visit In Chennai

sources.snippet: Bang in the middle of the city, the Chennai Snake Park is one of the first zoos to start in the city. Established by renowned herpetologist (reptile guy) and now Padma Shri Award winner Romulus Whittaker in the 70’s, the park houses 39 species of reptiles, including endangered and rare species like the famous Indian Gharial (a crocodile with thin jaws and a pot on its mouth) and the longest python species in the world, the reticulated python. As the name suggests, there are quite a few snakes here, and the park routinely conducts informative shows about all of these animals to help break the myths surrounding them.

reviews.reviewText:
5 Star | A Fascinating Experience for Reptile Enthusiasts

Entry Fee (Feb 2025):

Snake Park: ₹30 per person

Camera/Mobile Phone Charge: ₹20 (only for Snake Park)

Iguana Interaction Zone: ₹10 per person

Parking: Charged separately

The Chennai Snake Park, established in 1972 by renowned herpetologist Romulus Whitaker, is a unique attraction in Chennai, offering visitors an up-close look at a diverse collection of reptiles.

Pros:

✅ Diverse Reptile Collection – The park houses not only various snakes (including King Cobras, pythons, and vipers) but also crocodiles, turtles, and iguanas.
✅ Interactive Iguana Exhibit – Inside the park, there's a special iguana enclosure where visitors can touch and interact with the iguanas for an additional ₹10.
✅ Shaded Environment – Unlike many outdoor attractions in Chennai, this park is well-covered with trees, making it comfortable to visit even in summer.
✅ Adjacent to Guindy Children's Park – Since it's right next to Guindy Children’s Park, you can extend your visit if you're with family or kids.
✅ Washrooms Available – Basic facilities like washrooms are present inside the park.

Cons:

❌ Short Visit Duration – The park can be explored in 1.5 to 2 hours max, so it's not an all-day attraction.
❌ Less Crowd, Limited Buzz – While this ensures a peaceful visit, those expecting a bustling environment might find it a bit quiet.

Overall:

The Chennai Snake Park is highly recommended for snake and nature lovers, families, and those looking for an educational yet exciting experience. The well-shaded surroundings make it a good place to visit even in summer. While it’s not a full-day attraction, it’s definitely worth a visit if you're in Chennai!

Would I recommend it? Yes, definitely!

Chennai Snake Park – Informative and Fascinating Visit

Visited the Chennai Snake Park recently and had an enjoyable and educational experience. It’s a great spot for families, especially kids, to learn about reptiles in a safe and well-maintained environment.

Entry & Charges:

Parking fee: ₹50 for vehicles

Entry ticket: ₹30 per person

Camera charge: ₹20

What to Expect:

A wide variety of snakes on display, including both venomous and non-venomous species.

There are also crocodiles, lizards, and turtles in well-secured enclosures.

A small museum section inside showcases preserved specimens of reptiles and amphibians that have died naturally—very educational.

Informative boards and explanatory texts in English and Tamil are displayed near every enclosure, helping visitors learn about the species, habitats, and conservation efforts.

Suitable For:
Great for school trips, family outings, or nature lovers. The park is not too big, so it's easy to walk through in about an hour.
Overall: A good mix of education and wildlife exploration. Affordable, well-maintained, and worth visiting if you're in the Guindy area. Be sure to go early to avoid the crowd and heat!

Snake Review: "The Guindy Snake Park's incredible collection of snakes, including the majestic Indian Cobra, venomous Russell's Viper, and massive Reticulated Python, left me mesmerized and eager to learn more about these fascinating creatures."

Crocodile Review: "Getting up close and personal with the formidable crocodiles at the Guindy Snake Park was an exhilarating experience, and I applaud the park's efforts in providing a safe and natural habitat for these ancient predators."

Tortoise Review: "Watching the gentle giant tortoises roam freely and peacefully in their spacious enclosure at the Guindy Snake Park was a heartwarming experience, and a testament to the park's dedication to providing a nurturing environment for these incredible animals."
It's very good. There are many types of reptiles here. However, there are too many crocodiles and the cages need to be cleaned a little better.

The Chennai Snake Park, also known as the Guindy Snake Park, is India's first reptile park, established in 1972 by renowned herpetologist Romulus Whitaker.  Located adjacent to Guindy National Park on Sardar Patel Road in Chennai, the park spans approximately one acre and is managed by the Chennai Snake Park Trust, a non-profit organization dedicated to reptile conservation, education, and research.

Exhibits and Attractions

The park houses over 35 species of reptiles, including:

Snakes: King cobras, pythons, vipers, adders, and sand boas, displayed in glass-fronted enclosures.

Crocodilians: Indian crocodiles, Gangetic gharials, and exotic species like the Nile and Siamese crocodiles, kept in open-air enclosures.

Lizards and Turtles: Indian monitor lizards, iguanas, Indian black turtles, and flapshell turtles.

Aquatic Species: Water snakes and turtles housed in aquariums.

A notable feature is the Walk-Through Iguana Garden, where visitors can observe and feed iguanas and star tortoises in a naturalistic setting.

Educational and Conservation Efforts

The park actively engages in:

Captive Breeding: Programs for endangered species like the Indian rock python and Gangetic gharial.

Research: Studies on reptile behavior and conservation, including projects funded by organizations like the DRDO.

Public Education: Awareness programs, especially targeting school children, to dispel myths about reptiles and promote conservation.

Visitor Information

Timings: Open daily from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM, closed on Tuesdays.

Entry Fees: Adults ₹15, Children ₹5; Camera charges apply.

Facilities: Educational signage in Tamil and English, a museum with preserved specimens, and a library on reptilian biology.

Had a great time at the Snake Park with my friends! 🐍 It was fun, informative, and exciting to see so many different species up close. The park was well maintained. A good place to hang out, especially if you're into nature and reptiles!

There is an enclosure where you have to pay 10 Rs per head where Iguanas roam freely and there is a small pool for turtles. It was shicking to see people touching iguanas and picking up turtles. No staff was supervising the area. From a safety perspective too the Iguanas are potentially dangerous. They can bite, whip their tail and also spread salmonella when touched.

reviews.reviewText:
Chennai International Airport  is one of India’s busiest and most important gateways, especially for travelers heading to and from South India. Located in Tirusulam, about 20 kilometers from the city center, the airport comprises two main terminals: one for domestic flights and another for international travel.

The airport has seen significant upgrades in recent years, with efforts to modernize its infrastructure and improve passenger experience. The newer sections of the terminal offer better lighting, expanded seating, cleaner washrooms, and improved signage. However, parts of the airport, especially in the domestic terminal, still feel dated and can get overcrowded during peak hours.

In terms of amenities, the airport offers a decent selection of food outlets, both local and international, as well as a few duty-free stores and lounges. Free Wi-Fi is available, though the connection can sometimes be patchy. Security and immigration processes, while thorough, are known to be slow during busy periods, which can be frustrating for travelers.

Connectivity to the city is fairly good, with options such as taxis, app-based cabs, and a metro station nearby, although the walk from the terminal to the metro could be more convenient, especially with luggage.

Overall, Chennai International Airport is functional and steadily improving. With ongoing expansion projects, it has the potential to become a more efficient and comfortable travel hub in the coming years.

Review 1 (4 Stars - Positive, focusing on connectivity and recent improvements)

Title: Improved Experience with Great Connectivity!

Chennai International Airport has definitely stepped up its game! My recent travels through MAA have been much smoother. The new facilities are a welcome change, and the overall cleanliness has improved significantly. What truly stands out is the excellent connectivity to the city via the Metro. It's incredibly convenient to reach the airport and get into the city without hassle. While there can still be queues during peak times, the staff are generally polite and helpful. A good experience overall, making it a reliable gateway to Chennai.

The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, making the experience warm and welcoming. Every part of the airport is worthy of a selfie. So this is a wonderful gateway to Chennai and India!

The domestic terminal at Chennai Airport has improved a lot and offers a smooth travel experience. The check-in and security process is well organized, staff are polite and helpful, and the facilities are clean and well maintained. There are plenty of food and shopping options to keep you comfortable while waiting for your flight.

The terminal is spacious, signage is clear, and baggage handling is efficient. Overall, it’s a hassle-free and pleasant experience compared to many other busy airports.

A well-managed airport that truly makes traveling through Chennai convenient and comfortable. Highly recommended!

First time visiting Chennai International Airport and I’m genuinely impressed.
The airport is spacious, well-maintained, and efficiently managed. The facilities are modern and traveler-friendly, with clear signages and organized security checks. The terminal feels bright and open, offering a smooth experience from arrival to boarding. Clean washrooms, ample seating, and a good selection of food and retail options added to the comfort.

Chennai International Airport is one of the busiest airports in South India and offers a comfortable travel experience. The airport is well-structured with both domestic and international terminals conveniently connected. Check-in counters and security checks are generally smooth, and staff are courteous and ready to assist.

Inside the terminals, the cleanliness and maintenance are commendable. Seating arrangements are good, and the air conditioning keeps the environment comfortable even during peak hours. The airport provides a wide range of food courts, coffee shops, and restaurants serving both South Indian and international cuisines, making it convenient for travelers during long waits.

There are also several duty-free shops, convenience stores, and lounges, which add to the comfort. Clear signboards and digital screens make navigation easy, even for first-time travelers. Facilities like baggage handling, restrooms, currency exchange, and prepaid taxi counters are well managed.

Accessibility is another strong point—the airport is connected to the city by taxis, metro, and buses, making onward travel easy. Overall, Chennai Airport provides a safe, clean, and efficient travel experience and continues to improve with modern upgrades.

There are plenty of food stalls, waiting areas, and essential facilities like clean drinking water and restrooms. Connectivity is excellent, with metro, buses, and autos available right outside, making travel convenient.

However, the station can get extremely crowded, and during peak hours, it feels chaotic. Cleanliness is decent but could be better, especially in waiting areas. Another downside is the occasional delay in trains, which can be frustrating. Also, auto drivers outside tend to overcharge, so be cautious if you’re hiring one.

Overall, Chennai Central is a well-functioning and historic station, but some improvements in crowd management and cleanliness would make the experience even better!

A nicely maintained railway station with very neat and clean. From the car dropping or pickup point very wary to move to the platform unlike other big stations. All basic facilities are available within the station including ATM services. The station is now well connected with the metro which gives extra benefits to the passenger. A newly opened executive lounge facilities are also available with nominal price and all resting facilities.

I have travelled to and from Chennai via train for a over 3 decades now I think. So the railway station does bring out some nostalgia. The station is quite big with a lot of shops, eateries, etc. It has many of the problems that other stations have like cleanliness.

I am seeing a lounge for the first time in a railway station. Unfortunately, I didn't have a card that allowed me to enter.

I will always have a soft spot for this railway station.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
One of the busiest and most iconic railway stations in South India! The architecture beautifully blends colonial heritage with modern facilities. Trains connect you to almost every part of the country. The platforms are spacious, there are plenty of food stalls, and the staff are quite helpful. It can get very crowded, so plan ahead and stay alert with your luggage. Overall, a historic landmark and a gateway to Chennai’s vibrant city life. Highly recommended for travelers!

Chennai Central, located in the heart of the metropolitan city, is one of the busiest railway stations in India. While it sees thousands of travelers every day, the overall experience could be much better.

Despite being such a major hub, the station lacks proper maintenance. Cleanliness is a serious issue, public toilets are in poor condition, and there are not enough comfortable seating areas for passengers.

The premium lounge is only accessible to those who can afford it, while the government lounge is almost always overcrowded. For a city that deals with extreme heat and heavy passenger traffic, the station really needs improvement in infrastructure and basic amenities.

A station of this importance deserves better upkeep and facilities.
Busiest and Grand old station in South India. There are plenty of eateries inside it, with parcel facilities. Waiting hall is large. But baggage check is not done thoroughly.

Chennai Central Railway Station – a place where history meets chaos. Beautiful architecture outside, but the moment you step in, it’s like entering a live cricket stadium during World Cup finals… only without seats. Crowds everywhere, announcements on loop like background music, and the hunt for a clean washroom is more adventurous than catching your train. Food stalls? Plenty, but be ready for a trust fall with your stomach. Still, trains run on time (most of the time), and if you survive the crowd, congratulations — you’ve unlocked a true Chennai experience."

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: IIT Madras Campus is a sprawling campus with over 300 species of trees and plants, as well as native wild species like the elegant Blackbuck antelopes. It's conveniently located, with easy access to Chennai Airport and Central Railway Station. The campus is known for its picturesque greenery and top-notch faculty, offering diverse academic programs and emphasizing research and innovation.
placeMetadata.address: Sardar Vallabhai, Sardar Patel Rd, Indian Institute Of Technology, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600036, India

reviews.reviewText:
Living at the IIT Madras campus for a month was an unforgettable experience. The lush green surroundings and expansive campus provided an environment that felt both serene and vibrant. The sheer size of the campus, combined with its rich biodiversity—including the famous deer population—gave it a unique charm.

The academic atmosphere was palpable, with brilliant minds engaged in research and learning, fostering an environment of intellectual growth. The infrastructure was top-notch, from state-of-the-art labs and libraries to recreational facilities that kept me active and engaged.

One of the best aspects of the experience was the sense of community. The students, faculty, and staff were all welcoming, making it easy to settle in despite being there for a short period. The hostel life was enjoyable, offering not just comfort but a chance to connect with people from different backgrounds.

The food at the mess was diverse and catered to a variety of tastes, ensuring I never felt out of place. Additionally, the extracurricular opportunities, including cultural and tech fests, added a dynamic flavor to the stay.

Overall, the month I spent at IIT Madras left me with lasting memories of a holistic experience that blended academics, nature, and community living beautifully.

Iit Madras has an amazing campus with lush greenery, well maintained roads and a vibrant academic environment
The research facilities and labs are top notch, and the hostels are decent
My one suggestion, adding more streetlights in some areas would improve nighttime visibility

I recently had the privilege of visiting IIT Madras for the "All India Researchers and Scholars Summit," where an impressive gathering of knowledgeable individuals convened for insightful key notes and discussions. Amidst this vibrant intellectual exchange, I experienced firsthand the technical prowess that defines IIT Madras. The campus, pulsating with cutting-edge research and state-of-the-art laboratories, embodies a culture of innovation and excellence.

Adding to the allure of the campus is its captivating wildlife. Surrounded by lush greenery, IIT Madras is a haven for diverse flora and fauna, providing a serene backdrop to the rigorous academic environment. From playful monkeys to melodious birds, the campus wildlife enhances the experience, offering moments of tranquility and inspiration amidst scholarly pursuits.
I can't express the beauty of IITM just in some words. It's awesome tbh. And I like the deers more, really they feel me happy everytime...Feeling blessed to be a student of this insti.
Really a great campus where we live with nature. The deer walking along with us, beautiful mornings and full of trees. There are a lot of facilities in the campus

One of the best college and dream college for many. Very big campus. Nicely developed and well maintained. It's good to see that they care about the wildlife sanctuary. Washroom and shops are there at the right places.

Beautiful campus with natural beauty and habitat.
Love it
Very scenic campus, full of enthusiasm
