Best Time to Visit:
The best time to visit Cherai Beach is from September to February, when the weather is pleasant and ideal for outdoor activities.
Accommodation:
Cherai Beach offers a range of accommodation options, from budget-friendly guesthouses and homestays to luxury resorts and hotels.
Not recommended in monsoon if you prefer to touch water or be in sand… best time to visit: Sept-Nov! Calm place to hangout and relax!

Cherai Beach is approximately 25 km from downtown Kochi and 20 km from Cochin International Airport. Spanning about 10 km along the coast, it's known for its gentle tides and occasional dolphin sightings. The beach also offers a unique view where the backwaters meet the sea.

Cherai Beach, located near Kochi in Kerala, is a serene and scenic coastal destination known for its clean sands and gentle waves. Bordered by coconut groves and backwaters, the beach offers a peaceful ambiance ideal for relaxation. It is well-maintained and relatively less crowded, making it suitable for families and quiet getaways. Visitors can enjoy activities like swimming, beach walks, and occasional dolphin sightings. Overall, Cherai Beach presents a harmonious blend of natural beauty and calm, making it one of Kerala’s charming coastal retreats.
Visit this place after 4 pm you'll love this view 😍

Cherai Beach ⛱ is a beautiful destination with many shops to explore. It’s perfect for an evening visit, especially after 4 PM, when you can enjoy the cool breeze, picturesque sunset, and a vibrant local culture.

Cheari Beach is a decent destination that we've visited several times. It offers a pleasant beach experience, ideal for beach activities like swimming.

On weekends, it tends to get crowded, which can affect the overall experience. Parking can be a bit tricky during peak times, so it's best to arrive early.

The beach is conveniently located near shops where you can find food, drinks, and beachwear, making it convenient for a day out by the sea. Overall, Cheari Beach is a great spot for beach lovers, despite the weekend crowds and parking challenges.

reviews.reviewText: Really love this beach! Is usually crowded during weekends and holidays. Comparatively clean and has ample parking space. You get to fly kites, but be responsible, do not litter.

It felt like a replica of beautiful coastal village of good old times. Kerala never fails to amuse it's admirers. Just a 40 minutes drive from Kochi nestles this less crowded clean beach where you can spend your evenings cozily. I have never seen a beach where so different landforms coexist, you can experience the salty wind from the beach along with a visual treat of rows and rows of casuarina trees (kaattadi). Along side is a wetland area of a small lake with colourful boats and some frolicking cows. It also has mangroves, a must watch from the beautiful lighthouse nearby. The entry fees is just ₹10/- per person and ₹10/- for photography. It's in proximity to the beach. You will get a lot of refreshment snacks near the beach. If you wish to take photos or spend a quiet evening with privacy, opt this place. Weekends might be crowded.

placeMetadata.address: Vypin, Kerala, India

reviews.reviewText: The soft golden/white sand, pine trees & clean beach can make your day. Since this beach is secluded, it is peaceful and you can picnic with your family & friends for how long ever you want. Swimming & bathing in the waters can be done at your own risk.

It is so peaceful and no crowded beach.We can enjoy and spend time without any crowd and noises.The trees give more attraction.Will prefer more than Forty kochi beach , if you are looking for a beach tour.Sunset is so beautiful.Wind is non-stop , for kite flying.Small amount for parking charge.
This place will never let you go back and you will forget the passing time.✨
The soft sand, calm waves, and the  trees make it perfect for a peaceful walk. The sunset is amazing, but there aren’t many shops, so bring what you need.

Visited Kuzhuppilly Beach a few days ago, and I must say—it has now become my second favorite beach in Kerala after Varkala. The atmosphere was vibrant and full of life. Though the beach was quite crowded and parking was a bit tricky (we had to use paid parking), it didn't take away from the overall experience.

We reached around 6 PM, and the timing couldn’t have been better. The evening breeze, golden sunlight, and the sound of waves made for a really calming and scenic environment. The highlight of the visit was definitely the floating bridge. It costs around Rs. 120 per person, but it’s absolutely worth it. Walking over the waves on a gently swaying bridge while watching the sunset was a unique and memorable experience—it truly elevated our time at the beach.

Whether you’re there just to relax, enjoy the breeze, or take in the view, Kuzhuppilly Beach is a great spot. Definitely recommend it for an evening visit!

A picturesque beach surrounded by pine trees, perfect for spending quality time with friends, family, or children. There are small shops nearby offering quick snacks, and ample parking options are available, including both free and paid spaces.
Not too crowded. Peaceful beach. Floating bridge is a different experience. But allow to be there in the bridge only for 10 mins.

Perfect place in kochi to witness the sunset. The water is clean and weather gets pleasant in the evening. This place is little secluded therefore you can spend time with your loved ones.

This beach is roughly 3km from Cherai beach and is less crowded than Cherai beach making it a perfect spot. You can easily reach there using auto from vypin island ferry points.

Kuzhupilly Beach is a beautiful and peaceful spot located near the more popular Cherai Beach. What sets it apart is its serene atmosphere and the lush line of trees along the shore, which give the beach a naturally scenic and relaxing vibe.

One of the activities available here is a floating bridge experience. It costs Rs. 120 per person, and you get to spend about 10 minutes walking on the bridge, enjoying the views and the gentle sway over the water — a fun little addition to your beach visit.

You’re allowed to enter the water and enjoy a bath in the sea, making it a great place to unwind and cool off. The best time to visit is during the evenings when the light is perfect and the breeze is refreshing. However, weekends tend to be a bit crowded, so weekdays are definitely the better choice if you're looking for a calm and quiet outing.

Kuzhupilly Beach offers a clean, scenic escape that's perfect for a relaxing day, with a few simple activities to enjoy without the hustle of bigger tourist spots.

placeMetadata.name: Puthenthodu Beach
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Puthenthode Beach is a small, serene beach located in Chellanam, 12 km from Kochi city center. The beach is popular for its peaceful vibe and calm environs. It can be accessed by bus. Additionally, the coconut groves add to the vibes of the beach.
placeMetadata.address: Puthenthode Government School Rd, Kannamaly, Kochi, Chellanam, Kerala 682008, India

reviews.reviewText: If you're seeking a short, peaceful getaway with lovely sunset views and a tranquil ambiance, Puthenthodu Beach hits the mark.

It’s a very beautiful beach It’s got a more relaxed vibe, even on weekends. There’s parking available and while there aren’t many shops nearby. it’s still a great place to spend a day. The beach is spotless and you can even catch a beautiful sunset. The kids will love it too.

Very beautiful beach. Enjoyed with family. My kids had a great time. The sea is deep so swimming is not allowed but we can play with water. Some food items and icecream available. The sunset was absolutely mesmerizing. It will take maximum 45 mins from Fort Koch to reach this place and is the nearest open beach from Kochin. So if you are looking for a beach which is at a short distance from Kochi, this is the place.
Very nice beach, neat and clean. You can enjoy with family, friends etc. Its too dangerous if you go far beyond. Better not to go too far.
Nice clean beach with not many people. Calm and quiet place.

Beautiful Beach. You can go here to watch sunset. Also, You can take the dip as the water is clear. The beach is not too long or too small either.
However, I visited this place on a Sunday evening and It was very crowded. If you want some solitude go in weekdays or mornings.

A spotless beach with clear water. The surroundings are tidy with no litter. The sunset is mesmerizing. Best for spending time with friends and family. The water is deep, so it is better to swim near the side of the beach 🌊

Puthenthode Beach in Kochi features scattered rocks along its shoreline, enhancing the natural beauty of the coastal landscape. These rocks contribute to the uniqueness of the beach, providing picturesque views and interesting formations. Visitors often find these rocky areas captivating and they add an extra dimension to the overall charm of the beach. Exploring the beach, you'll encounter both sandy stretches and rocky formations, creating a diverse and visually appealing environment.It is Known for its tranquil atmosphere and scenic beauty, the beach offers a peaceful retreat with its golden sands and calm waters. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll along the shore, witness beautiful sunsets, and experience the local fishing culture. The beach is relatively less crowded, making it an ideal spot for those seeking a quiet escape near Kochi.

ops.insert: Long stretch of sand popular for walking, swimming, shell collecting & dolphin sightings.
Seafront beach offering a paved walkway with benches & views of large Chinese fishing nets.
This coastal area for swimming & fishing has eateries with water views & a relaxed vibe.

Marine Drive is a buzzing waterfront district known for the Marine Walkway, popular for evening strolls, and leafy Subhash Bose Park. The modern Rainbow and Kettuvallam bridges offer backwater views, and cruises leave from jetties by the water. Affluent homes and offices fill the area, and shops along Broadway sell jewelry, spices, and local fabrics. Dining ranges from upscale hotel restaurants to no-frills cafes.
Kerala-style palace originally built by the Portuguese in 1555 and later renovated by the Dutch.
Reclaimed island created in the 1930s with a main port, naval base warehouses, offices & hotels.
Elegant reconstructed 1880s Catholic church originally built by the Portuguese in the 1500s.
Quiet, forested nature refuge in the middle of the city attracting migratory birds & other animals.
Views & photo-ops of giant, iconic Chinese style fishing nets suspended from tall bamboo frames.

A charming seaside area, Fort Kochi is known for its Dutch, Portuguese, and British colonial architecture, and elaborate bamboo fishing nets at Fort Kochi Beach. St. Francis Church was the original burial site of explorer Vasco da Gama. Upscale eateries and chic cafes serve Keralan specialties, and quaint shops sell cotton clothing and handmade souvenirs. Heritage buildings house contemporary art galleries.
Small, lively beach known for picturesque sunset views & vendors selling casual street food.
Airport serving the Kochi area with domestic and international flights, plus bus links.

Kochi (also known as Cochin) is a city in southwest India's coastal Kerala state. It has been a port since 1341, when a flood carved out its harbor and opened it to Arab, Chinese and European merchants. Sites reflecting those influences include Fort Kochi, a settlement with tiled colonial bungalows and diverse houses of worship. Cantilevered Chinese fishing nets, typical of Kochi, have been in use for centuries.

Kumbalangi is a quiet, leafy island village known for rural tourism activities. People visit the island to see Chinese fishing nets, explore its mangrove forests, and experience traditional Keralan village life. Boat trips from Kallenchery cruise along the surrounding backwaters. Local artisans and boatmen offer craft demonstrations and fishing trips, while simple, no-frills eateries serve seafood and local meals.

Sprawling, residential Ernakulam is known for Marine Drive, a busy waterfront promenade where boats offer backwater cruises. The Kerala Folklore and Hill Palace museums explore local heritage through art and antiquities. Shops along Broadway and on MG Road sell fabrics, crafts, and spices, while modern Lulu Mall also has a cinema and an ice rink. Simple eateries serve Keralan specialties and South Indian seafood.

Munambam is a suburb of Kochi, India at the north end of Vypeen Island, surrounded by the Arabian Sea on the west, Periyar river on the east, and a mouth of the sea on the north. The main occupation of its inhabitants is fishing. Wikipedia.

Chilavannoor, or Chilavannur, is a high-value residential area of Kochi in the state of Kerala, India. Chilavannoor Road serves as its main artery, running from the Elamkulam junction and is 3 km in length. Wikipedia.
Broad, sandy beach popular for picnics & sunset views, with snack huts & a nearby lighthouse.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Kochi, a vibrant city on the southwestern coast of India, is not just known for its rich history and cultural diversity but also for its stunning beaches that offer a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. From the serene shores of Cherai Beach, where you might spot playful dolphins, to the picturesque Fort Kochi Beach, famous for its iconic Chinese fishing nets, each beach has its own unique charm. Whether you're looking to unwind with a book by the water or explore the local seafood scene, Kochi's coastline has something for everyone.

As you venture beyond the bustling city, you'll discover hidden gems like Kuzhuppilly Beach and the tranquil Andhakaranazhi Beach, where you can escape the crowds and soak in the natural beauty. The Wanderlog team is passionate about uncovering these coastal treasures, each offering a different experience, from breathtaking sunsets at Veeranpuzha Beach to the lively atmosphere at Marine Drive. So pack your beach gear and get ready to explore the best beaches that Kochi has to offer!
